name: Aarresaaren kotiseutumuseo
description:
Aarresaaren kotiseutumuseo is a local museum in Jämsä, Central Finland. It was founded in 1952 and is maintained by the Jämsänkoski Local History Association. The museum area was formed in the 1950s-1970s when buildings were moved there from the then-Jämsänkoski area.

The buildings of Aarresaari offer a journey back in time to the local history from the 16th century to the early 20th century. The buildings and objects display traditional agriculture and the early stages of industrialization. The museum has buildings such as storehouses, a watermill, a frame saw, a smoke sauna, and workers' cottages. The oldest buildings are the wilderness storehouses and watermills. The interiors and furniture in the old workers' cottages aim to reflect the authentic living conditions of the 1800s and early 1900s.

name: Aboa Vetus & Ars Nova
description:
Aboa Vetus & Ars Nova is a museum in the heart of Turku, Finland. It uniquely combines archaeology and contemporary art. Aboa Vetus (Old Turku) showcases the city's medieval history through underground excavations, revealing ruins of houses and streets. Ars Nova (New Art) features modern art exhibitions with Finnish and international artists.

The museum aims to connect the past and present, offering a glimpse into Turku's development over centuries. Visitors can explore archaeological finds and engage with contemporary art, creating a diverse cultural experience. It is located near the Aura River and easily accessible from the city center, making it a popular destination for tourists and locals alike.

name: Ahola
description: Ahola is a villa located by Lake Tuusula in Järvenpää. It was the home of author Juhani Aho and his wife, the painter Venny Soldan-Brofeldt. It was a central hub for the Tuusulanjärvi artists' community. The villa was originally built as a single-story house, with a second story added in the 1920s and renovated in the 1990s. The couple lived there from 1897 to 1911. Ahola opened as a museum in 1997, showcasing the couple's artistic work, including books, scripts, and translations. It is not a home museum, but focuses on exhibiting the artistic production of its residents.

name: Ahti Karjalaisen syntymäkotimuseo Lepola
description:
The Ahti Karjalainen Home Museum "Lepola" is located in the village of Kuitula in Hirvensalmi. It was the childhood home of Ahti Karjalainen, a significant Finnish politician. The museum is owned and maintained by the municipality of Hirvensalmi.

Lepola showcases life in the countryside during past decades. The yard features the main building from 1904, a barn, a shed, and a granary. The buildings represent a blend of architectural styles from the Häme region and the border region of Eastern Finland.

Inside, you'll find authentic items from the Lepola farm, offering a glimpse into early 20th-century everyday life. Lepola also served as the local post office until the 1960s.

name: Ahvenanmaan metsästys- ja kalastusmuseo
description: The Åland Hunting and Fishing Museum is located in Käringsund, Eckerö, in western Åland. Designed by architect Folke Wickström, the wooden museum building resembles a cluster of boat sheds. The museum showcases hunting and fishing equipment, the archipelago's fauna, nature, and culture. It tells the story of Åland islanders' daily life in the past, including hunting, fishing, and life in the archipelago. The exhibits, complemented by black and white photos and texts, illustrate life in fishing villages and markets, as well as seal hunting and net fishing. There are ramps both outside and inside the museum, as well as an accessible toilet.

name: Ahvenanmaan museo
description:
The Ahvenanmaa Museum is the main cultural history museum of the region, showcasing 7,500 years of the island's history, from the first inhabitants to the present day. The museum is located in Mariehamn, sharing a building with the Ahvenanmaa Art Museum, and one ticket grants access to both.

The museum's permanent exhibition covers five eras, from ancient times to the era of self-government. Visitors can explore the history of Ahvenanmaa, from seal hunters arriving on the rocky islands to today's global and multicultural society.

name: Aineen taidemuseo
description:
Aineen Art Museum, located in Tornio, is owned and maintained by the city. It houses the collection of Finnish art owned by the Aine Art Foundation. The museum exhibits Finnish art from the 19th century to the present day and also puts on temporary exhibitions, both domestic and foreign.

The museum building, which also houses the city library, was designed by architect Matti Porkka. From the museum's cafe, visitors can enjoy views over the City Bay and across the border to Sweden. The museum boldly showcases contemporary art exhibitions and displays the Aine Art Foundation's collections.

name: Ainola
description:
Ainola, meaning "Aino's Place," is the former home of the Finnish composer Jean Sibelius and his wife Aino. Located in Järvenpää, near Lake Tuusula, about 38 kilometers north of Helsinki, it provided Sibelius with the tranquility he needed for his work. The house, designed by Lars Sonck, was completed in 1904, with a second floor added in 1911.

Today, Ainola functions as a museum, offering visitors a glimpse into the life of the composer and his family. The museum displays original furnishings and personal items, and the garden is where Jean and Aino Sibelius are buried. Sibelius requested that the house have a view of the lake and a green fireplace in the dining room.

name: Aitonevan turvemuseo
description:
Aitoneva Peat Museum showcases the history of peat production in Finland. Located in Kihniö, the museum is in an authentic peatland environment. The exhibition details the different stages of peat production, from extraction to its final use, and also highlights environmental care and conservation aspects.

The museum operates in a renovated old office building, featuring a restored office of the former CEO. Outdoors, visitors can explore an extensive display of old production machines, some dating back to the 1940s. A lean-to shelter is available for visitors' use. During the summer, a cafe run by the Pirkanmaa Museum Railway Association is open. The Aitoneva area also includes a bird tower, an environmental trail, and two campfire sites.

name: Alatornion pitäjämuseo
description: The Alatornio Local Museum is located in a two-story granary next to the Alatornio Church. The museum's collection includes approximately 1,000 items, mainly folk-style household and utility items. The museum showcases artifacts collected from the villages of Alatornio, mainly in the 1960s, which tell about the area's life and livelihoods. The old granary was converted into a museum in 1964. The local museum is managed by the Tornio Local History Association. The museum is open during the summer.

name: Albert Edelfeltin ateljeemuseo
description:
The Albert Edelfelt Studio Museum is located in Haikko, Porvoo. The artist Albert Edelfelt had the studio built for himself in 1883. He spent 26 summers there and painted over 220 works. The museum was opened to the public in 1951.

In the studio, drawings, paintings, heliogravures and photographs, as well as objects belonging to the artist, are on display. The museum is managed by the Albert Edelfelt Foundation. In the vicinity of Albert Edelfelt's studio is Villa Albert, which houses an exhibition space for changing exhibitions and a museum shop.

name: Aleksis Kiven koti
description: Aleksis Kivi's home is located in Palojoki, Nurmijärvi. It is the childhood home of Finland's national author, Aleksis Kivi. He was born in the house on October 10, 1834. His father, Erik Stenvall, who was a tailor, built the house. Aleksis was the fourth child. The house and the village were dear to Kivi throughout his life. When visiting Palojoki as an adult, Kivi lived and wrote in the attic room of the house, the windows of which still offer views of the village fields. The house was opened to the public as a museum in 1951. The museum depicts the life of a tailor's family in the early 19th century.

name: Aleksis Kiven kuolinmökki
description: Aleksis Kivi's death cottage is located in Tuusula, Finland, on the Rantatie road. It is where the national author Aleksis Kivi spent the last months of his life in 1872. He was cared for by his brother Albert Stenvall's family in the Syvälahden torppa (cottage). Today, the cottage serves as a museum. It is owned by the Student Union of the University of Helsinki, and the Tuusula Historical Museum is responsible for its maintenance. The cottage is a reminder of what the Rantatie area looked like before the villas and the famous artist community were established. Inside the cottage, you can find some of Kivi's belongings, such as his student cap and walking stick. There is also a small sauna in the yard.

name: Alikartano
description:
Alikartano Manor, also known as Frugård, is located in Mäntsälä. The manor dates back to 1608, and from 1709 to 1912, it belonged to the Nordenskiöld family. Notably, it was the childhood home of Adolf Erik Nordenskiöld, the explorer who pioneered the Northern Sea Route.

The main building, constructed in 1805, showcases a blend of architectural styles, including Baroque, Neoclassical, and Rococo elements. Today, Alikartano serves as a museum, exhibiting the scientific achievements of the Nordenskiöld family. Some rooms are decorated in the style of the 19th century, offering a glimpse into the past.

name: Alvar Aalto -museo
description: The Alvar Aalto Museum, established in 1966, is located in Jyväskylä. It operates as part of the Aalto2 museum centre. The museum is dedicated to preserving and promoting the architectural and design heritage of Alvar Aalto. It showcases Aalto's life's work, delving into his architectural approach and design processes, whether for individual buildings, city centers, furniture, or regional plans. The museum's exhibitions feature architectural drawings, models, and design objects. The museum also explores Aalto's optimistic view that architecture and good design can solve problems related to human life and society.

name: Amos Rex
description: Amos Rex is an art museum in Helsinki, Finland, named after Amos Anderson. It is located in the Lasipalatsi building on Mannerheimintie boulevard. The museum opened in 2018 and has quickly become a popular destination. The building's design is unique, with the exhibition spaces located underground and covered by a distinctive undulating square. The museum focuses on site-sensitive, experiential, and technologically experimental exhibitions by contemporary artists. The entrance to Amos Rex is through the iconic Lasipalatsi ("Glass Palace"), a functionalist building from the 1930s that also houses restaurants, shops, and the Bio Rex cinema.

name: Amurin työläismuseokortteli
description:
The Amurin Workers' Housing Museum Quarter is located in Tampere. It showcases the lives of the working-class community in the late 19th and early 20th centuries. The museum consists of original wooden houses, carefully preserved to reflect the authentic living conditions of workers from local factories during the industrial expansion of Tampere.

Visitors can explore period furniture, household items, and artifacts that illuminate daily life. The museum tells the stories of the residents through decorated rooms representing different time periods between 1882 and 1973. There is also a shoemaker's workshop from the early 1900s, a 1930s bakery and cooperative shop, and a 1940s paper and haberdashery shop. The museum also has a cafe.

name: Ankkapurhan teollisuusmuseo
description:
The Ankkapurha Industrial Museum is located in Inkeroinen, Kouvola, within the premises of a former groundwood mill and cardboard factory established in 1872. The museum showcases the working and living conditions of the staff and the development of the forest industry over more than 150 years. A key exhibit is Finland's first continuously operating cardboard machine, a cardboard mangle that started in 1897 and was shut down in 1978.

Near the museum, the Warpunen Museum House displays the living conditions of workers in different decades, as well as the factory's office and office machines. The industrial area is recognized by the Finnish Heritage Agency as a significant monument of the Finnish forest industry. The museum is open during the summer and admission is free.

name: Annalan kotiseutumuseo
description:
Annalan kotiseutumuseo is one of the largest local history museum areas in Northern Finland. The museum area features 22 buildings and nearly 8,000 artifacts.

The museum displays rural life before the age of tractors. You can find a village shop from times of scarcity ("pula-aika"), a jail ("putka"), a soldier's croft, and even a windmill. The museum exhibits a wide range of items, from bank manager's hats to lumberjack's tools.

The Annala farm's origins date back to the 16th and 17th centuries. In the 1930s, the large farm became municipal property, housing the municipal office, wartime public welfare services, and a municipal secondary school. The museum was established in 1963 from items originating from the museum section of a local exhibition held in 1957.

name: Apteekkimuseo
description: The Pharmacy Museum and Qwensel House is located in Turku. It is the oldest wooden building in Turku and contains rooms decorated in the style of the 18th century, as well as the oldest pharmacy interior in Finland, dating back to the 19th century. The Pharmacy Museum showcases the history of pharmaceutical care. Qwensel House presents the life of the upper classes in 18th-century Turku. The museum has been in the house since 1958.

name: Arkkitehtuurimuseo
description:
The Museum of Finnish Architecture, located in Helsinki, is dedicated to architecture. Founded in 1956, it is the second oldest architectural museum in the world. The museum's origins lie in the Finnish Association of Architects' photographic collection, established in 1949.

The museum maintains extensive collections of drawings, photographs, and models, alongside a comprehensive library. Its activities include exhibitions both in Finland and abroad, research, publishing, and information services. The museum also offers guided tours in Finnish, Swedish, English and Russian. The building is accessible to disabled visitors via the inner courtyard entrance.

name: Askolan kotiseutumuseo
description: The Askola Local Heritage Museum is located next to the church in Askola, in a former granary. The museum showcases local history, including prehistoric times and Askola in the early 20th century, when agriculture was the main industry. The museum has artifacts related to prehistoric times and an exhibit about bread making, as Askola was known for its rye bread. You can explore old vehicles and a traditional Finnish feast display. One of the museum's treasures is a wooden bicycle from the early 1900s. The museum shop sells books and cards. The first exhibition was opened to the public in 1948, and in 1970 the exhibition was opened in a granary next to the church. The museum is open in the summer months.

name: Ateneumin taidemuseo
description:
Ateneum Art Museum is the most famous art museum in Finland and home to Finnish art. Located in the heart of Helsinki, it houses the country's oldest and largest art collection, with nearly 30,000 national treasures dating from the 18th century to modern art of the 1900s.

The museum showcases Finnish art history from Rococo portraits to experimental movements. The collections include masterpieces by Finnish artists such as Akseli Gallen-Kallela, Albert Edelfelt and Helene Schjerfbeck, alongside international works by Vincent van Gogh, Paul Gauguin and Edvard Munch. Besides the exhibitions, Ateneum also arranges workshops, lectures, guided tours and clubs every month.

name: Biologinen museo
description: The Turku Biological Museum, established in 1907, showcases Finland's natural history through detailed dioramas. It features thirteen distinct natural landscapes, displaying the diverse Finnish fauna and flora, from the Turku archipelago to the fells of Lapland. With around 30 mammal species and 136 bird species on display, the museum offers a comprehensive glimpse into the country's wildlife. The museum also hosts temporary exhibitions and events throughout the year. It is a popular destination for schools and families, offering educational experiences for all ages interested in nature and cultural history.

name: Cygnaeuksen galleria
description:
The Cygnaeus Gallery is the oldest art museum in Finland, situated in a charming wooden villa in Kaivopuisto Park, Helsinki. It showcases an impressive collection of primarily Finnish paintings and sculptures from the 19th century.

The gallery features works by the von Wright brothers, Albert Edelfelt, and Helene Schjerfbeck, along with sculptures by Walter Runeberg and Johannes Takanen. Opened to the public in 1882, it originated from the bequest of Professor Fredrik Cygnaeus, encompassing his art collection and the villa itself.

During the summer, the gallery hosts temporary exhibitions and various events. A museum shop and café are also located on site, where visitors can enjoy refreshments in the atmospheric garden.

name: Designmuseo
description:
The Design Museum, also known as Designmuseo in Finnish, is dedicated to showcasing both Finnish and international design. It features industrial, fashion, and graphic design. Situated in the Kaartinkaupunki district on Korkeavuorenkatu Street in Helsinki, the museum is housed in a neo-Gothic building completed in 1895, originally a Swedish-language school.

Founded in 1873, the museum moved to its current location in 1978. The Design Museum has a permanent exhibition on Finnish design history from 1870 to the present, in addition to temporary exhibitions. The museum's collection includes over 75,000 objects, 40,000 drawings, and 100,000 drawings. There is also a cafe and shop and the Museum of Finnish Architecture is located in the same city block.

name: Didrichsenin taidemuseo
description: The Didrichsen Art Museum is located in Kuusisaari, Helsinki. It was established in 1965 within a building complex designed by architect Viljo Revell for Marie-Louise and Gunnar Didrichsen. The museum features Finnish and international visual art, as well as artifacts from ancient cultures. The building is surrounded by a sculpture park that is always open to the public. The museum organizes approximately three temporary exhibitions each year. Villa Didrichsen was completed in 1957 as the family home, with the exhibition wing added in 1964. The museum showcases clean-lined modernism with influences from international concrete brutalism.

name: Ehrensvärd-museo
description:
The Ehrensvärd Museum is located in Suomenlinna, within the Commandant's House, originally the official residence for the fortress commanders. The museum showcases the history of the Swedish period in Suomenlinna. Augustin Ehrensvärd, the founder of the fortress, was the building's first resident.

Inside, the museum recreates an 18th-century noble residence, exhibiting portraits, furniture, weapons, and miniature ship models of the Swedish Archipelago Fleet. The house itself exemplifies how living quarters and defense structures were often combined. The museum is open daily during the summer and on weekends during the spring and autumn.

name: Einari Junttila -taidemuseo
description: The Einari Junttila Art Museum is dedicated to the works of the renowned Finnish painter Einari Junttila (1901-1975), who was known for his depictions of Lapland. The museum is located in Kittilä, in the heart of Finnish Lapland. It offers visitors a chance to explore Junttila's artistic journey and his deep connection to the Lappish landscape. The collection showcases his oil paintings and watercolors, capturing the beauty and spirit of the region.

name: Elävän kuvan museo
description:
The Museum of the Moving Image (Elävän kuvan museo) was dedicated to Finnish film culture. It was located in Helsinki and operated by the National Audiovisual Institute.

The museum's collections included over 10,000 objects primarily related to filmmaking from the 1930s to the present day. These included filming equipment, projectors, props, costumes, theatre tickets and film posters. The collection also featured pre-cinema material, like magic lanterns.

Located near the Kalasatama metro station, it aimed to evoke the atmosphere of old film studios. It showcased Finnish film history, displaying cameras, editing tables, costumes, and props, illustrating the evolution of filmmaking. Film projectors, illuminated advertisements, and old movie posters highlighted the allure of bygone movie theaters.

Unfortunately, the museum closed its exhibition space in Kalasatama on June 4, 2015, due to budget cuts.

name: Emil Aaltosen museo
description:
The Emil Aaltonen Museum, located in Pyynikinlinna in Tampere, showcases the life and work of Emil Aaltonen, a self-made industrialist.

The museum displays Aaltonen's art collection, featuring Finnish masters from the Golden Age, including works by Albert Edelfelt and the von Wright brothers. In addition to Finnish art, the collection also includes older foreign art.

The museum also features exhibitions on the history of the Ylikartano Manor and the Emil Aaltonen Foundation and has temporary exhibitions.

name: Emil Cedercreutzin museo
description:
The Emil Cedercreutz Museum in Harjavalta showcases the life's work of sculptor and silhouette artist Emil Cedercreutz. It's a blend of art and cultural history, featuring Cedercreutz's sculptures, silhouettes, and collections of artifacts.

The museum complex includes the artist's home, Harjula, built in 1914, and the Temple of the Rural Spirit, displaying folk art. Cedercreutz aimed to celebrate rural life and labor through his art and collections. The museum also hosts temporary exhibitions and has a sculpture park displaying Cedercreutz's works in a scenic riverside setting.

name: Enontekiön kotiseutumuseo
description:
The Enontekiö Local History Museum presents life in Enontekiö in the early 1900s. It's located three kilometers east of Hetta, towards Lake Vuontisjärvi. The museum resides in an area with a long history, inhabited as far back as the Mesolithic Stone Age, 5000-7000 years ago.

Founded in 1987 and opened to the public in 1991, the museum is owned by the municipality of Enontekiö and is open in the summer. The main building is the Hätänen house, moved from Raattama and built in the late 1800s. Other buildings include Vieno Kyrö's cottage from Ylikyrö (1920s), a glue storage building from the 1700s, a cowshed from Kaukonen dating back to before the wars, and a smoke sauna from Muotkajärvi (1937). The museum offers great views of Lake Ounasjärvi and Pallas-Yllästunturi National Park.

name: Eräjärven kivimuseo
description:
The Eräjärvi Stone Museum, maintained by the Eräjärvi-Seura association, is open during the summer. It showcases an extensive collection of Finnish and foreign rocks, minerals, precious stones, and jewelry. The museum was founded in 1974 and is located near the Eräjärvi wooden church in a former granary built in 1864.

Eräjärvi has a long history in the stone industry and stone processing. The museum introduces visitors to the region's stone types, minerals, and the history of the local stone industry. Exhibits include Finland's largest collection of agates and a unique collection of synthetic gemstones. The nearby Viitaniemi mine is known as a rich source of various minerals and is open for daytime visits, with tickets available at the Stone Museum.

name: Espoon Automuseo
description:
Espoo Car Museum is one of the largest car museums in Finland, showcasing over 200 vehicles and related artifacts. It's located in a vast granite stone barn, offering a unique and captivating atmosphere across two floors. The museum displays a wide array of cars, motorcycles and mopeds.

Visitors can explore exhibits featuring sports cars, classic American models, and vehicles manufactured in Eastern Europe, alongside motoring-related memorabilia like posters, magazines, and tools. The museum hosts various events, including swap meets and gatherings.

name: Espoon kaupunginmuseo KAMU
description:
Espoo City Museum, known as KAMU, vividly and interactively showcases the history of Espoo from the Stone Age to the present day. Located in the WeeGee Exhibition Centre in Tapiola, it features a permanent exhibition about the history of Espoo, called "A Thousand Stories from Espoo".

The museum also hosts various changing exhibitions on different historical themes. KAMU isn't just one location; it encompasses several museum sites, including the Glims Farmstead Museum in Bemböle, the Lagstad School Museum in Espoo Centre, and the Villa Rulludd summer villa museum by the sea in Kaita. These locations allow visitors to explore different aspects of Espoo's past, from rural life to coastal culture.

name: Espoon modernin taiteen museo Emma
description:
EMMA, the Espoo Museum of Modern Art, is one of Finland's leading art museums. It focuses on Finnish and international modernism, contemporary art, and design. EMMA is located in Tapiola, Espoo, within the WeeGee Exhibition Centre, a landmark building of industrial architecture designed by Professor Aarno Ruusuvuori.

As the largest art museum in Finland by area, EMMA offers powerful art experiences and spatial sensations. Its collections include the Espoo City Art Collection, the Saastamoinen Foundation Art Collection, and the Tapio Wirkkala Rut Bryk Foundation Collection, showcasing a wide range of artistic expressions. EMMA's exhibitions present current phenomena in international contemporary art and design, as well as classics of modernism and Finnish design.

name: Etelä-Karjalan Automuseo
description:
The Etelä-Karjalan Automuseo, or South Karelia Car Museum, is located in Korvenkylä, north of Lappeenranta. You can find it at Karjalanportti, near highway 6. The museum operates in an old barn and is open during the summer, from May to the end of August.

The museum offers a glimpse into Finnish motoring and traffic culture through the decades. The exhibition is updated annually to keep it interesting. The main focus is on cars and motorcycles, but there are also dozens of other items related to transportation on display, such as old horse carriages and snowmobiles. The museum also has a collection dedicated to Imatranajo road racing history. In 2023, the museum was chosen as the Automotive Museum of the Year.

name: Etelä-Karjalan museo
description:
The South Karelia Museum is located in Lappeenranta Fortress, in former artillery warehouses built in the early 1800s. Unlike other neoclassical buildings in the area, it's made of local limestone. The museum's collections are based on those of the Lappeenranta, Viipuri, and Käkisalmi museums.

The main exhibition, "The Story of South Karelia", is being implemented in stages. A restored model of Viipuri, an exhibition about Finnish Viipuri, and the Pusukioski are the first parts of the renewed exhibition. A museum shop connected to the museum sells unique products based on the museum's collections. The museum showcases the history of South Karelia and the ceded territories.

name: Etelä-Pohjanmaan maakuntamuseo
description:
The Etelä-Pohjanmaa Regional Museum is located in the Törnävä district, about three kilometers from the center of Seinäjoki. It serves as the central museum for cultural history in South Ostrobothnia and also functions as the city museum of Seinäjoki. The museum aims to maintain and strengthen the understanding of the region's culture, history and environment.

In addition to the main building, the area includes Törnävä Manor buildings and an open-air museum, showcasing 18 peasant buildings from the 17th to 19th centuries, relocated from different parts of South Ostrobothnia. The main exhibition, "Mihinä me ollahan?" (Where are we?), is located in the old stone barn of the manor.

name: Etelä-Pohjanmaan traktorimuseo
description: The Etelä-Pohjanmaa Tractor Museum is located in Nurmo, Seinäjoki. It houses a large collection of tractors, being the biggest private tractor collection in Finland. The museum is located in an old youth center building renovated in 1978, with an additional hall built between 2001 and 2003. The museum was opened in 2004. The collection consists of around 150 tractors, with approximately 100 of them restored to working condition. The museum was founded by Matti Jaskari, whose interest in tractors began in his childhood.

name: Ett Hem
description:
Ett Hem is a charming museum located in Turku, Finland. It is housed in a beautifully preserved yellow wooden building on Piispankatu, near the Turku Cathedral. Ett Hem was once the home of Consul Alfred Jacobsson and his wife Hélène.

The museum showcases the couple's collected furniture, art, and textiles, offering a glimpse into a bourgeois home from the turn of the 20th century. Visitors can admire paintings from the Golden Age of Finnish art and experience the ambiance of a bygone era. The museum's collections include antiques, early 20th-century electric lamps, sofas, and various utensils, all contributing to the authentic interior. Ett Hem provides a unique cultural experience, allowing visitors to step back in time and appreciate the lifestyle of a prominent Turku family.

name: Fiskarsin museo
description:
Fiskars Museum is located in the heart of the famous Fiskars ironworks village. The museum preserves and researches the ironworks culture from the 17th century to the present day. The main exhibition allows you to immerse yourself in history through various activities.

You can spin a time machine and spot exciting objects related to the history of the ironworks, play a fine workshop memory game, try the work of a clerk, or even dress up as an ironworks patron. The museum also includes a museum building that used to be the machine shop's office, a working baking cottage, and a former dining hall for workers called Slaggbyggnaden, which was later converted into a residential building. There is also a lovely Café Hammarbacken.

name: Forssan luonnonhistoriallinen museo
description:
The Forssa Natural History Museum is both a natural science and nature conservation museum. It's owned and maintained by the Southwest Häme Nature Conservation Association. The museum allows you to explore birds and mammals more closely than ever possible in nature.

The main exhibition (800m²) features 6,000 items, including approximately 1,000 stuffed animals. In addition to animals, there are also numerous types of rocks on display. Special collections include animal color variations, chimeras, and deformities. The famous "Häme Wolf" is also on loan. The museum's history began in 1951, opening to the public in 1968 and moving to its current location in the Kehräämö area in 1988.

name: Forssan museo
description:
Forssa Museum is located in the old cotton warehouse in the historical Spinning Mill area. The main exhibition, "The City of Colourful Cloth," tells the story of the factory town and its community from the early 1800s to the present day. The museum vividly presents the history of the Forssa region, also considering children.

Downstairs, Galleria Moletti, with its rugged red-brick walls, hosts monthly changing art exhibitions. The exhibition space is available for artists to rent. The Forssa Museum's collections include archive textiles, objects, and a large photographic collection. There is also the Forssa Nature Museum, which showcases the nature of Southwest Häme and nature conservation efforts.

name: Forum Marinum
description:
Forum Marinum is a maritime museum and a versatile center for maritime activities located by the Aura River. It is Finland's national maritime museum and navy museum. The museum showcases various exhibitions related to seafaring, port operations, and shipbuilding.

During the summer season, the museum ships are open to the public, offering a unique experience. The museum is housed in the Kruununmakasiini and Linnanpuomi buildings. Forum Marinum is a great destination for the whole family, with historical information and modern skills creating the basis for the maritime center.

name: Friitalan nahkamuseo
description:
The Friitala Leather Museum is a specialized museum dedicated to the leather industry, maintained by the city of Ulvila. It's located in the Friitala House, which was formerly the Friitala leather factory. The museum showcases the history of leather manufacturing and fashion, as well as the evolution of the industrial community that grew around the leather factory over more than a century.

The museum features a main exhibition called "Friitalan aika" (The Time of Friitala), and also hosts changing exhibitions. One current exhibition, open from February 14, 2025, to February 28, 2026, explores the history of the Kaasmarkku woolen mill and the mills along the Kaasmarkunjoki river. The museum is a member of the European Route of Industrial Heritage.

name: Gallen-Kallelan museo
description:
The Gallen-Kallela Museum is located in Espoo, Finland. It is housed in Tarvaspää, a studio-castle designed by the artist Akseli Gallen-Kallela for himself. The museum showcases Gallen-Kallela's art and life, along with exhibitions of his contemporaries and contemporary art.

The museum provides a look into the life and work of Akseli Gallen-Kallela, one of Finland's most important artists. The beautiful setting and unique architecture offer a wonderful backdrop for a museum visit. Besides art exhibitions, the museum also hosts various events and activities. The museum also has a museum shop and a cafe.

name: Galleria Oskari Jauhiainen
description:
Galleria Oskari Jauhiainen is located in the Syke-talo building in Kiiminki, Oulu. It showcases the life's work of Oskari Jauhiainen, a sculptor born in Kiiminki. The gallery features a permanent exhibition of Jauhiainen's work, including over 20 bronze and wood sculptures, as well as ceramics by Anja Juurikkala, a student of Jauhiainen.

In addition to the permanent collection, the gallery also hosts changing exhibitions, coordinated by Valve's community culture. Oulu Art School UPIA also holds art exhibitions in Galleria Oskari Jauhiainen. The gallery is open during the opening hours of the Kiiminki library.

name: Gillesgården
description:
Gillesgården in Parainen is an agricultural and homestead museum. It is located in Pojo, which is now part of the city of Raseborg. Gillesgården is one of the attractions in the parish village of Pojo. It's a historically significant site, showcasing the area's agricultural heritage.

Gillesgården is also located on Auragatan 1 in Turku. The building dates back to the early 1700s, before the great fire of Turku. Today, it serves as a versatile space for meetings, celebrations, and hobbies. For example, the SFP in Åbo, the Swedish People's Party in Turku, has office space in Gillesgården. The building also offers spaces for rent.

name: Hakamäen museoalue
description:
Hakamäki Museum Area is an open-air museum in Savitaipale, Finland, established in 1953. It showcases local heritage with buildings, artifacts, and textiles. The museum complex sits on a lush hill, offering scenic views of Lake Kuolimo.

Besides the main building, the area includes a windmill, storehouse, soldier's croft, smoke sauna, threshing barn, and a 14-meter observation tower built in 2008. The museum hosts various events, such as music and theater performances, and the Hakamäki Picnic music event. The diverse forest surrounding the museum is a nature conservation area.

name: Hakasalmen huvila
description:
Hakasalmen huvila is a valuable building from a historical architecture perspective, located in Etu-Töölö, Helsinki. It was built in 1843-1846 as a summer residence for Carl Johan Walleen's family. The villa was designed in the neoclassical style by the German-born architect Ernst Lohrmann. In 1896, the City of Helsinki purchased the villa from Aurora Karamzin.

Since 1911, it has housed the Helsinki City Museum, which organizes changing exhibitions. The villa is located on Mannerheimintie, opposite the National Museum, next to Finlandia Hall. Originally, it was located a bit outside the city, by the Töölönlahti bay. Today, it represents one of the few remaining examples of Empire-era villa architecture in Helsinki.

name: Halosenniemi
description:
Halosenniemi is the former studio and home of Finnish painter Pekka Halonen, completed in 1902. Situated on the shores of Lake Tuusula, it exemplifies Finnish National Romantic architecture. Halonen designed the house himself, and it served as both a residence and a workspace.

Today, Halosenniemi functions as a museum, showcasing Halonen's art and life. The museum also features exhibitions of other artists, often linking their work to Halonen's. The building's architecture combines traditional Finnish construction with influences from European national romanticism. The surrounding landscape, which inspired much of Halonen's work, is a protected nature reserve. The museum provides insight into the artistic community that flourished around Lake Tuusula in the early 20th century.

name: Halsuan kotiseutumuseo
description:
Halsua Local Heritage Museum is located in the village of Meriläinen. The museum showcases the development of peasant traditions starting from the 18th century. The beautiful yards and buildings with unique artifacts bring visitors closer to the life of times past.

The museum area consists of over 20 buildings and thousands of items donated by residents of nearby municipalities. Kraatarintupa, built in the 1820s, is located in its original location. The museum hosts various events and exhibitions. The museum is open during the summer, and at other times by appointment.

name: Haminan kaupunginmuseo
description:
The Hamina City Museum is located in one of Hamina's oldest buildings, constructed around 1760. Known as the "Catherine's Palace", it famously hosted a meeting between Empress Catherine II of Russia and King Gustav III of Sweden in 1783. The museum moved into the building in 1957.

The museum's main exhibition showcases the history of Hamina and its residents, alongside rotating temporary exhibitions. The upper floor offers a charming space for workshops and events and can be rented for meetings. Other museums in Hamina include the Merchant House Museum and the Vehkalahti Village Museum.

name: Harjamäen sairaalamuseo
description:
The Harjamäki Hospital Museum is located in Siilinjärvi and showcases the history of the Harjamäki mental hospital, which operated from 1926 to 1997. The museum presents the perspectives of both patients and staff. It also explores the history and development of psychiatry and psychiatric treatments in Finland. The museum displays items related to treatment, instruments, and belongings of patients and staff.

The museum is usually open during the summer, but it is possible to visit throughout the year by arranging a visit in advance. The building is accessible by elevator, but it is recommended to contact the staff beforehand.

name: Hausjärven kotiseutumuseo
description:
The Hausjärvi Local History Museum is the oldest local history museum in Kanta-Häme, Finland. It was established in 1949 and opened to the public in 1950. The Hausjärvi Local History Association, founded in 1948, was granted the use of a grain warehouse built in 1853 next to the church. Artifacts were collected from all over the village with the help of village agents.

The museum's renovated main exhibition opened in 2021. It showcases key aspects of Hausjärvi's history through objects, photographs, and texts. The oldest items date back to the Stone Age, with the majority from the 18th and 19th centuries. The museum is open during the summer, and admission also grants access to the Koskela Local Heritage House exhibitions.

name: Heinäveden kotiseutumuseo
description:
The Heinävesi Local History Museum is located in Kirkkotie 3. The museum was founded 60 years ago and its exhibition was renovated in 2021. The exhibition provides a good overview of the history of Heinävesi and the life of its inhabitants. The museum is open in July and admission is free.

The museum building is unique, and its collections are located on the second floor. The exhibits showcase local history, dating back 5,000 years to prehistoric times. Inside, you can find notes about grain quantities and dates written in pencil on the logs.

name: Helsingin Diakonissalaitoksen museo Diamus
description:
Diamus is the museum of the Helsinki Deaconess Institute, dedicated to the life's work of its founder, Aurora Karamzin. It showcases the 150-year history of the institute.

The museum's collections primarily consist of objects and photographs from before the 1960s, when the institute functioned as a sister home. The exhibits use modern technology and feature fourteen stories about the institute's history that visitors can listen to. The museum displays items found in the institute's closets and drawers, where old, disused items had been collected for decades.

name: Helsingin Väestönsuojelumuseo
description: The Helsinki Civil Defence Museum offers a glimpse into civil defense history, particularly focusing on Helsinki during the Second World War (1939-1944). Located in an authentic wartime bomb shelter in the Kruununhaka district, the museum showcases civil defense then and now. Visitors can explore exhibits detailing life during the war, including a recreated bomb shelter with sound effects to simulate the experience. The museum features technical equipment, literature, and other materials related to civil defense. Guided tours are available, and the Helsinki Civil Defence Association organizes safety training for groups and school classes on request.

name: Helsingin kaupunginmuseo
description:
The Helsinki City Museum is the only museum in the world dedicated to the history of Helsinki. Located in the corner of Senate Square, in the oldest quarters of the city, it offers visitors new perspectives on the city's past. The museum showcases the everyday life of Helsinki residents, highlighting heart-warming details and atmospheric spaces.

The permanent exhibition "Helsinki Bites" delves into the city's past, bringing to the surface shared memories of Helsinki's history. The Children's Town allows kids to explore the olden days through play. A time machine with virtual reality equipment transports visitors back one hundred years. The building also houses a museum shop and the El Fant café-wine bar. Admission to the Helsinki City Museum is free.

name: Helsingin observatorio
description:
The Helsinki Observatory, completed in 1834, is a science museum that offers insights into the history, present, and future of astronomy. Designed by C.L. Engel, it's located on Tähtitorninmäki Hill. The exhibitions combine history and modern technology, focusing on visual and participatory experiences.

The observatory features old astronomical instruments, like the meridian circle, in their original locations. Visitors can explore the solar system, the universe, and Finnish astronomy history in different halls. The building also houses the Ursa Astronomical Association and the University's Almanac Office. It is part of the Helsinki University Museum Flame.

name: Helsingin pitäjän kotiseutumuseo
description:
The Helsingin pitäjän kotiseutumuseo, or Helsinge hembygdsmuseum in Swedish, is a small local museum in Vantaa, located in a former granary building next to the St. Lawrence Church. It showcases artifacts from the area, primarily collected from local farms, dating back to the pre-industrial era.

Inside the granary, you can explore exhibits recreating a peasant home and chamber from the 1800s, including a school corner. The museum was opened in September 1963 and is run by the local youth association, Helsinge-Tusby ungdomsförbund. It is open during the summer, from June to August, on Wednesdays and Sundays, and at other times by appointment. There is no entrance fee. The museum also participates in local events like Christmas events with the St. Lawrence Church.

name: Helsingin taidehalli
description: The Kunsthalle Helsinki, or Helsingin Taidehalli, is a non-profit exhibition space showcasing contemporary art, design, and architecture. Founded in 1928 by Finnish artists and art associations, it hosts 5–7 major exhibitions and events annually. The building itself is a notable example of 1920s classicism in Finland and has been renovated several times, most recently in 2009. Located on Nervanderinkatu 3, it also houses a small museum shop called Kioski and the Restaurant Finnjävel.

name: Helsingin taidemuseo HAM
description: HAM, or Helsinki Art Museum, is the city's art museum that maintains and expands Helsinki's art collection, consisting of over 10,000 works, including public artworks. Located in Tennis Palace, HAM showcases modern and contemporary art in its domestic and international exhibitions. A part of the museum is dedicated to exhibiting the work and life of Tove Jansson. HAM also curates and produces the Helsinki Biennial contemporary art event. The museum aims to maximize the presence of art in Helsinki, striving to be a vibrant visual arts city in Northern Europe by inspiring and connecting people through art.

name: Helsingin yliopistomuseo
description:
The Helsinki University Museum, now known as Tiedemuseo Liekki (Science Museum Liekki), is maintained by the University of Helsinki. It is located in the University's main building. The museum safeguards the cultural and historical collections of the University of Helsinki, including the founding charter of the Turku Academy from 1640 and the silver scepters used at the academy's inauguration. Besides the main building, the museum also includes the Observatory and the Drawing Hall of Porthania.

The museum's collections also include a large photograph collection with pictures of the university's history as well as the history of medicine, veterinary medicine, and dentistry. The museum also maintains the University of Helsinki's art collection, which includes works of art, portraits, paintings, and sculptures in university buildings.

name: Herraskosken kanavamuseo
description: The Herraskosken kanavamuseo is located in Virrat, next to the Heritage Village. The canal itself was built between 1903 and 1907 and connects the lakes Vaskivesi and Toisvesi. The museum showcases the history of the canals in the Häme region. The museum building was constructed based on the drawings of an old outbuilding. The area surrounding the canal has been preserved to look original, with rows of fir trees planted along the sides. The canal environment exemplifies Jugend style canal construction.

name: Herttoniemen kartanon museo
description:
Herttoniemi Manor Museum, also known as Herttoniemen kartanon museo, is located in eastern Helsinki. The museum resides within a classical mansion surrounded by a landscape park.

The exhibitions showcase items dating back to the early 19th century, highlighting the life of Admiral Carl-Olof Cronstedt and an upper-class family from the 20th century. The museum complex includes a windmill and Knusbacka farmstead, which was moved from Sipoo.

The museum is open to the public on Sundays from May to September, and guided tours are available. From October to April, the museum is open only for pre-booked tours. The manor's park and gardens are also notable, featuring a Baroque-style park and an English-style garden.

name: Hiekan taidemuseo
description: Hiekan Art Museum is the oldest private art museum in Finland, established in 1931. It was founded by goldsmith Kustaa Hiekka, considered a pioneer in Finland's precious metal industry. The museum's collection features Finnish art from the 1850s to the present, as well as foreign art from 1630–1910. Besides paintings and sculptures, the museum displays antique furniture, silver objects, and ethnographic items collected by Hiekka during his travels. The building itself, designed by Oiva Viljanen, was the first in Tampere specifically built for museum use. The museum hosts both permanent exhibitions showcasing its collection and temporary exhibitions, also chamber music concerts. Currently, the museum is temporarily closed for renovations.

name: Hiihtomuseo
description:
The Ski Museum (Hiihtomuseo) is a specialized museum dedicated to skiing and winter sports. It is located in the Lahti Sports Center, at the foot of the Salpausselkä ski jumping hills. The museum collects, preserves, exhibits, and researches traditions related to winter sports, especially skiing, ski jumping, and biathlon.

The museum's collections include 22,000 objects, 16,500 photographs, and over 7,000 stamps and stamped envelopes. The main exhibition showcases Finnish skiing history from various perspectives. Visitors can explore the history of Finnish competitive skiing from the 1950s to the 1970s. The museum also has a ski jumping simulator and a laser shooting range for biathlon, offering interactive experiences.

name: Hollolan kotiseutumuseo
description: The Hollola Local Heritage Museum is situated in the heart of Hollola's church village, near the medieval stone church. It comprises two parts: the museum of objects and the house museum area, which is about 200 meters away. The object museum, housed in an old granary, showcases traditional peasant artifacts from Hollola. It features exhibits like a village shop display and unique lemonade-making tools, along with flax, school, and parish sections. The house museum area includes buildings representing local history and culture. Annually, the Finnish traditional sahti ale championships take place at the open-air museum.

name: Hotelli- ja ravintolamuseo
description:
The Hotel and Restaurant Museum specializes in Finnish food and beverage culture, as well as the history of accommodation and dining. Located in Kaapelitehdas, Helsinki, the museum collects, studies, and preserves Finnish cultural heritage related to food, drink, hotels, restaurants, cafes, and tourism.

The museum's collections include items, photographs, archives, and a library, spanning from the 1700s to the present day. The permanent exhibition showcases Finnish food and drink culture, taking visitors through the history of tourism and exploring the world of restaurant and hotel staff. Interiors from the 1950s to the 1970s are also on display. The museum also hosts temporary exhibitions, workshops, and guided tours.

name: Huittisten museo
description:
Huittinen Museum is a local cultural-historical museum with an extensive art collection. It's located in a historically valuable area next to the church of Huittinen. The magnificent stone storehouse is full of things to see for lovers of history and art.

In the museum, you can explore the local peasant culture through a diverse collection of artifacts. There are also exhibitions dedicated to President Risto Ryti and sculptor Lauri Leppänen, both of whom were born in Huittinen. The museum also features themed exhibitions that showcase the handicrafts of Siina Rinne, the ITE art of Hugo Kivinen, and a collection of over 600 knives. A replica of the 7000-year-old moose head sculpture is another highlight.

name: Huvilamuseo Villa Rulludd
description:
Villa Rulludd is a villa museum located on a beautiful peninsula in Espoo, along the Espoo waterfront. It represents a unique and well-preserved example of early villa architecture on the Uusimaa coast. The villa offers a glimpse into the summer life of the culturally influential Kihlman family for six generations, until the City of Espoo acquired it in 1980.

Built in 1873 by Alfred Kihlman, a prominent figure in politics, business, and education, the villa was later expanded in 1908. Today, the upper floor houses the museum, while the lower floor is used for private events. Villa Rulludd provides guided tours and digital content to explore its history.

name: Hvitträsk
description:
Hvitträsk is a unique architectural complex located in Kirkkonummi, about 30 kilometers west of Helsinki. Designed by the architects Gesellius, Lindgren, and Saarinen as their studio home, it later became Eliel Saarinen's private residence. Completed in 1903, the building showcases National Romantic architecture, featuring a combination of natural stone and dark logs.

Hvitträsk, whose name means "White Lake", consists of a main building with two wings and a separate villa. The architects' shared studio was located between the wings. The complex includes meticulously maintained gardens and wooded areas.

Until 2024, Hvitträsk functioned as a museum, attracting visitors with its unique design and history. Although the museum closed due to budget cuts, it remains a significant cultural landmark.

name: Hyvinkään kaupunginmuseo
description:
Hyvinkää City Museum is a cultural history museum that documents and presents the history of Hyvinkää and its residents. In 2022, the Hyvinkää City Museum merged with the Hyvinkää Art Museum to form the Museokeskus Taika (Museum Centre Taika).

The museum has two locations. One of them is Valvillan Factory Museum which is located in the courtyard of the old wool factory. It showcases how wool is made into fabric and yarn, featuring machines, products made by the wool mill, and photographs depicting the daily life and workers of the factory halls. The museum also presents local history of Hyvinkää with photos and films.

name: Hyvinkään taidemuseo
description:
Hyvinkää Art Museum is located in the heart of Hyvinkää, presenting art in the second floor of the Jussintori business building since 1982. In 2022, the Hyvinkää City Museum moved to the same location, and together they form the Museokeskus Taika (Museum Centre Taika).

The art museum showcases Finnish art and works by local painters like Tyko Sallinen and Helene Schjerfbeck. The museum has two works by Schjerfbeck, "Marianne in Ruovesi" (1926) and "Station Master's Daughter" (1918-1923). Its own collections include "Girl" (1875) and the oil painting "Two Figures" (1943). The Taidelabra exhibition space features paintings and other works by Yrjö Saarinen and Kaapo Wirtanen. The museum also hosts temporary exhibitions, changing three times a year.

name: Hämeen linna
description:
Hämeen linna, or Häme Castle, is a medieval castle in Hämeenlinna, Finland, on the shore of Lake Vanajavesi. It's one of Finland's medieval royal castles. Construction began in the late 13th century, initially as a gray stone camp castle. The castle has served as a military stronghold, administrative center, and prison throughout its history.

Over the centuries, it has been modified and expanded. In the 18th century, it was converted into a prison, and further alterations were made according to Carl Ludvig Engel's designs in 1837. Today, Häme Castle is a museum and a popular tourist attraction. It is part of the Linnanniemi museum area, along with Museo Militaria and the Prison Museum.

name: Hämeenlinnan kaupungin historiallinen museo
description: The Hämeenlinna City Museum, formerly the Hämeenlinna City Historical Museum, is a regional museum of cultural history in Hämeenlinna. The main exhibition spaces are located in Museo Skogster, which opened in the summer of 2016, near the Hämeenlinna Church and the Town Hall. The museum presents the history of Hämeenlinna and the surrounding countryside from the 18th century to the 1970s. Themes include the development of the city, changes in the cityscape and structure, transport and livelihoods. Besides Museo Skogster, other destinations of the museum are the Sibelius Birth House, Palander House and the Savings Bank Museum.

name: Hämeenlinnan kaupunginmuseo
description:
The Hämeenlinna City Museum is a regional museum located in Hämeenlinna. The main exhibition spaces are located in Museo Skogster, which opened in the summer of 2016. Museo Skogster is near the Hämeenlinna church and the city hall.

The City Museum maintains Museo Skogster, Palander House, the Sibelius Birth Home, and the Savings Bank Museum. The first three museum spaces are located in the center of Hämeenlinna, about 350 meters from each other. In addition to exhibitions about the history of Hämeenlinna, the building houses the City Museum's office and research services. On the first floor of the building, you can find ticket sales, a reference library, and a museum shop. The exhibition spaces of Museo Skogster are spread over two floors.

name: Hämeenlinnan taidemuseo
description: Hämeenlinna Art Museum is located near the center of Hämeenlinna. It is a diverse museum showcasing visual arts in two buildings within the Verkatehdas area. The museum features temporary exhibitions presenting various movements in visual arts, from old art to the newest styles of contemporary art. The collections are based on art evacuated from the Vyborg Art Museum. The museum was opened in 1952 and its collection includes several important works of Finnish art, as well as newer art and contemporary art.

name: Härkätien museo
description:
Härkätien museo is a cultural history museum located in Renko, near the medieval Church of St. James. The museum showcases the history of Hämeen Härkätie, local peasant culture, and the history of the Renko Church.

The museum building itself is a former granary built in the mid-19th century. The Renko-Seura association maintains the museum, and it houses a collection of local artifacts related to peasant life, the ancient Hämeen Härkätie road, and items from the history of Renko's St. James Church. One of the special items is a complete distillery from the 1800s. The museum is open on summer Sundays and on Renko market day, or by appointment.

name: Iisakin Jussin tupa
description:
Iisakin Jussin Tupa is a peasant museum located in Kosolanmäki, Kauhava. The main building represents the South Ostrobothnian architectural style of the late 1800s. The house, chambers, and upper floor are furnished with original furniture. The owner of the house worked as a "fankiföörari" (prison guard), and prisoners were held there before being transported to Vaasa Castle.

In addition to the main house, the yard includes seven other buildings that belonged to a farm. The Kosolanmäki storehouse, dating back to the 1850s, is also located nearby. It has been preserved in its original condition and is now used for various exhibitions and events. The museums are maintained by the Kauhava-Seura association.

name: Ilmajoen museo
description:
Located by the Kyrönjoki river in the center of Ilmajoki, the Ilmajoki Museum is housed in a beautiful building that was completed in 1914. The building is a replica of Ilmajoki's second church, dating back to the 1600s. It stands as one of Finland's oldest local museums, boasting an extensive collection of around 15,000 items.

Among its unique exhibits are artifacts related to the Könni clockmakers, the Cudgel War, and Jaakko Ilkka. The museum grounds also feature a former blessing chapel serving as a church museum, a windmill, granaries, and the Aalto battery tradition house. It's a fascinating destination for those interested in history.

name: Imatran taidemuseo
description:
The Imatra Art Museum, established in 1951, is one of the oldest art museums in rural Finnish towns. It is currently located in the Kulttuuritalo Virta, south of the Imatra City Hall, in Mansikkala.

The museum's collections include over 1,400 works owned by the City of Imatra and the Imatra Art Association. The museum focuses on Finnish art from the 20th century, especially early 20th-century art and the modernist decade of the 1950s. The Sihtola collection, owned by the art museum, is nationally significant, featuring modernist Finnish, Swedish, French, and Italian art from the 20th century.

name: J. L. Runebergin koti
description:
J.L. Runeberg's Home is located in Porvoo and was the residence of Finland's national poet, Johan Ludvig Runeberg, and his wife Fredrika, from 1852 until his death in 1877. After Fredrika's death, the state purchased the house and its contents, turning it into a museum in 1882. It is the oldest home museum in Finland.

The museum showcases the Runeberg family's furniture, art, tableware, and Fredrika's beloved houseplants, many grown from cuttings. The house represents a typical 1850s middle-class home, featuring Biedermeier-style furniture. The museum also includes a garden where roses, mock-orange, and fruit trees blossom in the summer. You can find hunting weapons and porcelain in the cupboards, offering glimpses into the family's daily life.

name: J. V. Snellmanin kotimuseo
description:
The J. V. Snellman Home Museum is located in Kuopio, in the Väinölänniemi district. It is a museum dedicated to the life and work of the Finnish philosopher and statesman Johan Vilhelm Snellman.

The museum is housed in the building where Snellman lived with his family in the mid-1800s, specifically from 1845 to 1849. The house itself is a typical upper-class residence from that era in Kuopio, featuring a hipped roof and windows with six panes. The museum is furnished with items and furniture that belonged to the Snellman family.

Visitors can explore Snellman's life in Kuopio during the 1840s and learn about his work as a headmaster, journalist, and family man. The museum provides insights into the life of an upper-class family and the early history of Kuopio. The building, also known as the Oppman House, was built in 1827.

name: Jakokosken museokanava
description:
The Jakokoski Museum Canal is located in Kontiolahti, about 20 kilometers east of Joensuu, by a bend in the Pielis River. The canal was built over a century ago to ease river traffic past the rocky rapids. Originally, the canal had wooden locks, which were replaced with stone and concrete structures in 1907.

Later, from 1956 to 1973, the entire Pielis River was graded, and the old stone and concrete locks were turned into a museum. The Jakokoski Museum Canal has since been restored to showcase canal life, log driving, and old ways of life from the past. Old tools and equipment related to canalisation are displayed in the outbuildings. The canal area also features museum ships, machines, and equipment. The Kontiolahti summer theater has been operating at the Jakokoski museum canal since 1982.

name: Jan Karlsgården -ulkomuseo
description:
Jan Karlsgården is an open-air museum located in Kastelholm, Åland, Finland. It consists of buildings relocated from different parts of Åland, showcasing the island's building and living culture. Founded in the 1930s and inspired by Skansen in Stockholm, its purpose is to display Åland's traditional way of life.

The museum features over twenty buildings, representing an Ålandic farm from the late 1800s. You can explore a main building, small cottage, storehouses, and farm buildings. Traditionally, a Midsummer pole is erected every year, and Åland's largest Christmas market is held here. While the museum is open year-round, the buildings are accessible to visitors only during the summer months.

name: Joensuun taidemuseo
description:
Joensuu Art Museum, also known as Joensuun taidemuseo Onni, is an art museum maintained by the city of Joensuu, Finland. Established in 1962, the museum's collections include donated works and acquisitions.

The museum's foundation lies in the art collection bequeathed to the city by Olavi Turtiainen. Later, the collections were supplemented by Arla Cederberg's collection and Onni Okkonen's art collection, including his library and archives. The permanent exhibitions display Finnish art from the Golden Age of the late 19th century to contemporary art, as well as a collection of Orthodox icons characteristic of Eastern Finland. The museum is located in a Neo-Renaissance building in the city center, previously a lyceum.

name: Johannes Linnankosken nuoruudenkoti
description: Johannes Linnankoski's childhood home, Niemenpelto, is a museum located in Vakkola, Askola. This is the former home of the author Vihtori Peltonen, known as Johannes Linnankoski. The museum was founded in 1938 and showcases much of the original furniture from the village of Vakkola, along with items that belonged to Linnankoski himself. Visitors can view displays of Linnankoski's literary works and photographs. The house was built in 1886, offering more space for his large family. Today, a visit to Linnankoski's childhood home is a trip to the beautiful finnish countryside and a perfect way to learn about the life and works of this famous author.

name: Johannes Lohilammen museo
description:
Johannes Lohilammen museo is located in Sammatti, Lohja. The museum is a preserved 18th-century cavalry estate. The main building was completed in 1778.

The museum displays a collection of rural artifacts primarily from western Uusimaa, gathered by farmer Johannes Lohilampi (1866-1938). The collection was organized by his brother, Kaarlo Vanamo. In addition to the peasant collection, you can see a crucifix in the church room and a collection of pewter dishes. There is also a room decorated with school items and some items that belonged to Elias Lönnrot. The museum area includes a raised granary, outbuildings, a grain store and a stone cowshed. The old barn is used as a venue for changing exhibitions.
The museum is open during the summer.

name: Jokioisten museorautatie
description:
Jokioinen Museum Railway is a narrow-gauge railway located in the municipalities of Jokioinen and Humppila. It is the only narrow-gauge railway in Finland that has been open to public passenger and freight traffic and has been preserved to this day. Originally, the railway connected Humppila and Forssa.

The museum railway is 14 kilometers long. Trains run on Sundays during the summer months. The railway's gauge is 750 mm, about half the width of the Finnish state railway network. The route has three stations: Jokioinen, Minkiö, and Humppila. Minkiö also houses a unique Narrow Gauge Museum. There are five operational steam locomotives, built between 1901 and 1948, and about ten passenger cars.

name: Juankosken tehtaan ja työväen museo Masuuni Brunou
description:
The Masuuni Brunou Museum delves into the industrial past of Juankoski, Finland. It resides within a former blast furnace structure, centrally located in the old foundry area alongside the rapids.

The Juankoski Heritage Society established the museum in 1991 to preserve the region's cultural and historical legacy. Its exhibits showcase foundry products, local history, and the lives of area residents. The museum's name, "Blast Furnace Brunou," originates from the building's original function and Brynolf Brunou, one of the foundry's founders. The main hall highlights the transition from peasant life to ironworking, and the factory's evolution from ironworks to cardboard mill. The second floor displays products from the foundry, while other floors feature rotating themed exhibits. The museum primarily exhibits ironworks products from the 1900s and is open during the summer months.

name: Juutilan valimomuseo
description:
Juutilan valimomuseo is a unique sand casting museum located in Vehkalahti, Kaavi. It operates in an old foundry and is open during the summer.

The museum showcases the history of sand casting. Notably, the skills initially learned at the Juantehdas foundry are still alive within the Juutilainen family. They specialize in church bells, which are manufactured in a new foundry building and exported internationally. It is about a 15-minute drive from the ironworks area on the Kaavi side.

name: Jyrkkäkosken ruukki
description:
Jyrkkäkoski Ironworks, located in Sonkajärvi, was founded in 1831. It exemplifies the shift of iron industry focus to Eastern Finland in the 19th century, utilizing lake and bog iron. The ironworks produced high-quality pig and bar iron and operated until 1919. In 1874, a new Scottish-style blast furnace made of English brick was erected.

The Finnish National Board of Antiquities carried out conservation and reconstruction in 1996-98, including protective structures over the blast furnaces. Today, Jyrkkäkoski is an architectural attraction. The site features a cafe, Ruukin Tupa, and a museum with rotating art exhibitions. Visitors can enjoy fishing, a 25 km rafting route on the Nurmijoki River, and the 30 km Volokinpolku trail. Annual events include Ruukinmessu and Valoshow.

name: Jyväskylän taidemuseo
description: The Jyväskylä Art Museum is located in the center of Jyväskylä, near Kirkkopuisto park. Its exhibitions primarily showcase Finnish contemporary art, with a focus on art graphics and art from Central Finland. The museum organizes exhibitions, both independently and in collaboration with various partners. They also present national visual art to the Central Finland audience, and international art graphics and drawing. Functionality, experience, and learning are important starting points in the exhibitions. On the third floor, there is an art space where one can observe the phenomena of art and science in a fun way. The museum shop sells souvenirs such as art books, cards, and jewelry.

name: Järvenpään taidemuseo
description:
Järvenpää Art Museum is located near the Järvenpää railway station.
The museum's collections consist of art by Eero Järnefelt and Venny Soldan-Brofeldt.
Järvenpää Art Museum has a permanent collection exhibition of Eero Järnefelt and Venny Soldan-Brofeldt, as well as changing exhibitions and diverse events throughout the year.
In addition to the art of the collection artists, the museum also occasionally features art by other artists.
In 2025, Järvenpää Art Museum and Ainola are celebrating Jean Sibelius' 160th anniversary with a joint exhibition.
Taneli Eskola's nature photographs and Otso Vartiainen's light art transport the visitor to the world of forest and silence.

name: Jäänmurtaja Tarmo
description:
The Jäänmurtaja Tarmo is a Finnish steam-powered icebreaker built in 1907 in Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom. It was the third state-owned icebreaker of Finland and the last steam-powered icebreaker in service. Today, Tarmo is a museum ship located in Kotka, at the Maritime Centre Vellamo.

Tarmo served for many years, assisting winter traffic and ships in distress. It also saw service during both World Wars. In the 1930s, the ship rescued hundreds of fishermen and horses from drifting ice floes. After being decommissioned in 1970, it was decided to preserve the vessel. It was completely restored in the early 1990s. Visitors can explore the ship, from the bridge to the engine room, and learn about its history.

name: K. H. Renlundin museo
description:
The K. H. Renlund Museum is located in Kokkola and serves as the regional museum for Central Ostrobothnia. The museum acts as an expert on cultural heritage in its area. The museum has multiple locations, including Roos House, Exhibition Hall, Lassander House, and Pedagogy, all of which are open throughout the year.

Roos House features changing art exhibitions and a collection of Finnish art from the Golden Age donated by Karl Herman Renlund. The Museum Quarter includes the Exhibition Hall, which focuses on contemporary art, and the Pedagogy, which showcases the history of Kokkola. Other museum destinations include the English landing craft, Lohtaja Heritage Museum, and the home of Fredrik and Anna Drake.

name: K. H. Renlundin museo – Keski-Pohjanmaan maakuntamuseo
description:
K. H. Renlund Museum is the regional museum of Central Ostrobothnia, located in Kokkola, Finland. It serves as an expert on cultural heritage in the region. The museum has several locations, including the Roos House, which features changing art exhibitions, a glimpse into the Roos family's life, and a collection of Finnish Golden Age art donated by K. H. Renlund.

The museum's regional responsibilities include promoting museum activities, art, and cultural environment tasks, such as archaeological heritage and built environment consultation. In addition to Roos House, the museum also encompasses other sites like the Exhibition Hall, Pedagogy, Lassander House, and Leo Torppa's Camera Collection.

name: Kainuun Museo
description: The Kainuu Museum is a regional museum owned by the city of Kajaani, located near the Kajaani railway station in a commercial building completed in 1931. The museum's main exhibition presents the history and culture of the Kainuu region and the town of Kajaani. It covers diverse topics, including the use of wood, tar production and transportation, the life of Elias Lönnrot, the area's military history, and old urban life in Kajaani. Temporary exhibitions complement the main exhibition or showcase different themes. The museum's collections also include art, with the first works acquired in 1934.

name: Kajaanin taidemuseo
description:
Kajaani Art Museum opened in April 1993 and is located in the heart of Kajaani in the old police station, designed by architect Eino Pitkänen. The building, completed in 1936, represents functionalism.

The museum's collections mainly feature Finnish art from the 1980s and 1990s. The museum also manages the art collection of the city of Kajaani. Works belonging to the city's art collection are exhibited in several public spaces in the city. The museum has four temporary exhibitions each year. The museum's approach is active and inspiring and it offers interesting contemporary art both nationally and internationally.

name: Kalan torppa
description: Kalan torppa is a museum located in Hahtomaa, Kauhava. It marks the founding place of Finland's first youth association, Kauhavan Nuorisoyhtiö. The interior reflects the style of the 1880s, and some of the furniture are original items donated by the Kala family. The building itself was brought from Evijärvi and chosen to resemble the original cottage as closely as possible. The museum is maintained by the Kauhava-Seura association. Kalan Torppa traditionally hosts the Midsummer festival, which starts the Midsummer celebrations in Kauhava.

name: Kalela
description:
Kalela is the wilderness studio and home of Akseli Gallen-Kallela, a Finnish national artist. Located in Ruovesi, it stands as one of Finland's largest log buildings from the 19th century, with its original structure still intact. Situated amidst a pine forest in Ruhala, on the shores of Lake Näsijärvi, the building spans 18 x 16 meters, with a roof reaching 13 meters in height.

Constructed from durable, dead standing pine, Kalela represents not only Gallen-Kallela's architectural genius but also the skill of the thirteen rural carpenters who built it in a year. Designed as both an artist's studio and a family home, Kalela embodies Gallen-Kallela's architectural aspirations and was built according to his detailed drawings in 1894 and 1895. It draws inspiration from the Finnish national epic, Kalevala, evident in its images, carvings, etchings, stained glass, and early Finnish design elements. Today, Kalela functions as a home museum, though it is not always open to the public.

name: Kallioniemi
description: Kallioniemi in Kuusamo is closely associated with Kalle Päätalo, a famous Finnish author. It is the location of Kuusamo Outdoor Museum which includes Päätalo's childhood home, offering a glimpse into his life and the history of the area. The museum showcases peasant life from the early 20th century, including daily routines and celebrations by the lake. Tuomo Kallioniemi, an engineer and author researches the local history of Kuusamo.

name: Kalvolan kotiseutumuseo
description:
Kalvolan kotiseutumuseo is a local museum in Hämeenlinna, specifically in the village of Keikkala in Kalvola. It's situated next to the Kalvola church, in an old granary built in the late 1850s. The museum was founded in 1968 by the Kalvola municipality's cultural board. Currently, the Kalvola-Seura association maintains it.

Inside, you can see the granary's original equipment. There's also an exhibit about stonework, with tools, texts, and photos showing the different stages of the craft. The museum showcases items from Kalvola's past churches, and there's a section dedicated to the history of schooling in the area. The upper floor depicts the importance of forests and wood to the region, symbolized by the municipality's coat of arms. A 15-meter-long series of paintings by Valto Kokko illustrates the transport of timber along the Hämeen Härkätie road to Turku.

name: Kangasalan kotiseutumuseo
description:
The Kangasala Local Heritage Museum is located in an old stone granary built in 1833-1835, opposite the Kangasala Church. The museum was founded in 1958. The museum is open only in the summer, from June 1st to August 31st, from Tuesday to Sunday.

Inside, you can explore the history of Kangasala through objects, notable people, and changing exhibitions. The museum is managed by the Kangasala-Seura association. The collections consist of about 1700 donated items from the locals. On display are items from past centuries, such as tools and household items used in building, hunting, and fishing. There are also exhibits depicting how royals and the upper class lived in the 1500s. Outside the museum, you can see orbicular granite dating back over 2000 million years.

name: Kansallisgalleria
description: The Finnish National Gallery is the largest art museum institution in Finland. It consists of three museums: Ateneum, Kiasma, and Sinebrychoff Art Museum. The Finnish National Gallery preserves cultural heritage, promotes artistic understanding, and puts on diverse exhibitions. It also manages the national art collection and its archives. The Ateneum has art from the 18th century to modern times. Kiasma is a museum of contemporary art. Sinebrychoff Art Museum focuses on European old masters.

name: Karhulan ilmailukerhon lentomuseo
description:
The Aviation Museum of the Flying Club Karhula is located at the Kymi Airfield near Kotka. It is the only one of its kind in the Kymenlaakso region. The museum has about 20 aircraft on display, some of which are in running, taxiing, or flying condition.

Although the Flying Club Karhula saved its old Harakka I glider for museum purposes as early as 1959, the actual museum operations began in 1992, when the Finnish Air Force handed over a Fouga CM 170 Magister jet trainer to the club for preservation. The museum hangar was completed in the fall of 1995, and it was expanded in 2008. The exhibition space covers 600 square meters. The aviation museum is run by the Flying Club Karhula.

name: Karkkilan ruukkimuseo Senkka
description:
Karkkila Foundry Museum Senkka is a specialized museum dedicated to the history of the foundry industry. It showcases the manufacturing and casting of iron, as well as the lives of the workers in the foundry community.

The museum includes the Finnish Foundry Museum, the Högfors blast furnace, and the Karkkila-Högfors Workers' Museum. The Finnish Foundry Museum features exhibitions such as "Traces of Casting," the Högfors Museum, Galleria Bremer, and Huitin Art Room. These sites are located in a still-active historical foundry environment by the Karkkila rapids. The blast furnace and workers' museum are open during the summer, and during the winter season by appointment for groups.

name: Kaskisten kalastusmuseo
description:
