The Kaskinen Fishing Museum, established in 1983, is located in the old fishing harbor of Kaskinen. It resides in a former salting house purchased by the city from Kurt Koskinen. Before becoming a museum, the building housed a fish shop owned by Oskar Koskinen since the 1910s.

The museum's exhibits are thematically arranged, showcasing herring, whitefish, salmon, and seal fishing, along with river fishing. On display are various items and tools used in fishermen's homes and coastal barns. The museum has a collection of over 400 items and old photos. Many photographs depict fishing, with a special focus on herring fishing, which was once Kaskinen's most important livelihood. Around the museum, you can find coastal barns that date back to the 19th century.

name: Kastelholman linna
description:
Kastelholm Castle is a medieval castle located in Sund, Åland. Construction of the castle began in the late 14th century, and it became the administrative center of Åland in the early 15th century.

The castle consists of a main castle and a bailey to the north. The main castle measures about 30x20 meters, while the bailey is about 45x25 meters. Originally, the castle was built on a small island with rows of poles surrounding it to prevent landings. The most prominent part of the castle is the high Kuri Tower, located in the center of the castle.

Throughout its history, Kastelholm Castle has served as an administrative center and has been the site of sieges, attacks, and witch trials. In the 17th century, the castle lost its significance as an administrative center, and in 1745, a large part of it burned down. Today, it is a popular tourist attraction.

name: Kasvimuseo
description:
The Kasvimuseo, or Botanical Museum, is part of the Finnish Museum of Natural History, which belongs to the University of Helsinki. It's located within the Kaisaniemi botanical garden in Helsinki. The museum houses extensive collections of vascular plants, mosses, and fungi, including lichens.

Researchers from Finland and abroad use these collections. The museum participates in international loans and exchanges of specimens. Although there aren't public exhibitions, there have been occasional open house events. The Botany Unit's teams conduct research on plant and fungal taxonomy, systematics, evolution, and conservation biology.

name: Kauhajoen kirkkomuseo
description: The Kauhajoki Church Museum is located near the main church. During the summer, it aims to keep the same opening hours as the Kauhajoki Church. In the summer of 2021, the church museum was transformed into a "museum chapel" where ecclesiastical services and various events can be held. In the museum chapel, you can explore the old objects of the parish. In winter, you can inquire about the opening hours of the museum chapel from the sexton or parish master.

name: Kauhajoen kotiseutumuseo
description: The Kauhajoki Local Heritage Museum, owned by the Kauhajoki Museum Association, is located in the center of the town, close to the Parliament Museum and the veterans' Heritage House. The museum's buildings and objects showcase peasant life from the 1800s to the 1940s. There are 11 buildings that have been moved to the museum area. The oldest building dates back to 1789, and the other ten are from the 1800s. These include a two-story main building, a gatehouse, a cart shed, and a windmill. In the summer of 2025, the museum is open on Sundays and Mondays in June, July and August.

name: Kaunislehdon talomuseo
description:
Kaunislehto House Museum is located in Hyrynsalmi. It showcases a farm from about a century ago. The museum consists of around 20 buildings, some original to the site, others brought from different parts of the municipality. These buildings represent the traditional construction methods of the Kainuu region.

Visitors can explore not only the buildings but also equipment related to pearl fishing, an iron smelting furnace, and a tar pit. The museum displays how people lived and worked in the past. Kaunislehto was chosen as the Local Museum of Eastern Finland in 2023. The museum is owned by the municipality of Hyrynsalmi.

name: Keitele-museo
description:
The Keitele-Museo is a specialized, interactive museum located in Suolahti. It preserves the heritage of the Keitele waterways and railway traffic in the Suolahti region. The museum collects and restores old railway equipment, maintaining it through volunteer work. A highlight is the museum train journeys organized throughout the summer, primarily using a diesel engine train known as "Lättähattu".

The museum's base is at the Old Station locomotive depot. Both the old station building and the locomotive depot are protected sites. Besides train trips, Keitele-Museo arranges events and open house days in collaboration with other operators, offering a closer look at the locomotive depot area and facilities. At many events, you can even try riding a three-wheeled rail tricycle. Unlike traditional museums, Keitele-Museo is mainly an outdoor museum where the rolling stock isn't just displayed but also used.

name: Kellokosken sairaalamuseo
description:
The Kellokoski Hospital Museum showcases the history of mental healthcare, with both its successes and failures. Established in 1973, it is located within the Kellokoski Hospital area in a blue wooden building that once served as the head physician's residence in the 1930s.

The museum's collection, which began in 1915, includes objects reflecting the patients' states of mind, such as Princess's embroidery, items made by patients during therapy, old hospital equipment, furniture, clothing, and documents. You can explore the evolution of different treatments, the hospital's activities during the war years, and the lives of patients and staff. Exhibits include items like an electric shock device and lobotomy instruments. It tells of the richness and vulnerability of the human mind, and the dedication of healthcare professionals to psychiatry.

name: Kemijärven kotiseutumuseo
description:
The Kemijärvi Local History Museum, situated near the heart of Kemijärvi, portrays peasant life in the Kemijärvi region during the early 1900s. Its main building, a traditional Ostrobothnian farmhouse from the 1800s, stands in its original location. The museum showcases Kemijärvi's traditional livelihoods from a century ago, including agriculture focused on cattle, forestry, fishing, hunting, and reindeer husbandry.

The museum complex features a main building, cowshed, stable, sheds, a smoke sauna, and a smithy. The main building is furnished in an early 20th-century peasant style, with museum artifacts displayed in other buildings. The museum is maintained by the local heritage association Kemijärven Kotikiekerö ry.

name: Kemijärven moottorikelkka- ja sahamuseo
description: The Kemijärvi Snowmobile and Saw Museum features a unique collection of snowmobiles from the past to the present day. There are over 200 old snowmobiles and nearly 500 chainsaws on display. The snowmobile museum has over 100 sleds, mainly from the 1960s and 1970s. Among other things, the first factory-made snowmobile bought to Finland, a Ski-Doo from 1961, is on display. The museum is owned by the Kemijärvi Motor Club and is open by appointment.

name: Kemin historiallinen museo
description:
The Kemi Historical Museum offers an immersive journey into the history of Kemi and its surrounding areas. The main exhibition, "City of the Sea and River," showcases the rich local cultural heritage and explores the impact of the sea and river on the region's culture, livelihoods, and the development of the wood processing industry.

Inside the museum, you can also find a gallery with changing exhibitions, ensuring something new to see on each visit. The museum's collections include a replica of the Crown of the King of Finland, crafted by goldsmith Teuvo Ypyä, and a detailed scale model of the Laitakari sawmill island, depicting the history of industrial production in the city's early days. Admission to the Kemi Historical Museum is free. It is open Monday to Friday from 10 AM to 5 PM and Saturday from 10 AM to 3 PM and closed on Sundays.

name: Kemin taidemuseo
description:
The Kemi Art Museum, established in 1947, is Northern Finland's oldest art museum and one of Finland's regional art museums. Its collection originated from lecturer Ape Rantaniemi's collection of 136 works, primarily featuring early Finnish modernism. Today, the museum's collection holds approximately 2,700 pieces, including paintings, drawings, sculptures, and prints from the early 1800s to the present day.

The museum focuses on showcasing contemporary art from Lapland and hosts 6-7 temporary exhibitions annually in a bright exhibition space designed by Sebastian Savander within Kemi's Cultural Centre. Besides exhibitions, the museum provides a fantastic setting for various festivities and concerts. Admission to the Kemi Art Museum is free.

name: Kenkämuseo
description:
The Shoe Museum in Tampere was a unique museum that showcased footwear-related exhibits at the Vapriikki Museum Centre from 2003 to 2015. The museum's collection included Finnish shoes from the late 1800s to the 2010s, along with a cultural-historical shoe collection that started in the early 1900s.

The idea for the museum originated in 1937, with the collection starting the same year. In 2003, the museum opened as part of Vapriikki, featuring the "Story of a Thousand Shoes" exhibition, which presented Finnish shoe industry, design, and fashion. The exhibit replicated a factory floor, illustrating shoe manufacturing processes with machines and animation. Although the permanent exhibition closed in 2015, research and exhibition activities continue.

name: Keravan taidemuseo
description:
Kerava Art Museum, also known as Taide- ja museokeskus Sinkka, focuses on contemporary art. Besides the changing art exhibitions, the museum arranges discussions, lectures, and workshops.

Founded in 1990, the Kerava Art Museum was initially run by volunteers. In the 2000s, when the museum became owned by the city of Kerava, it began to be managed professionally. In 2012, the art museum moved to its current location in Sinkka.

Currently, Taide- ja museokeskus Sinkka is closed due to renovation work and will reopen in 2026. The museum showcases current art, interesting cultural phenomena, and local industrial design heritage and past. In addition to exhibitions, Sinkka offers various cultural events, guided tours, lectures, concerts, and programs for families with children.

name: Keski-Suomen luontomuseo
description:
The Natural History Museum of Central Finland is a natural science museum that operates as part of the Jyväskylä University Science Museum. It is located in Vesilinna, on Jyväskylä's Harju ridge. The museum's main exhibition, "Heritage as Environment," showcases the nature of Central Finland from the oldest bedrock to the present day.

The museum aims to help people discover, understand, and appreciate the biodiversity of nature. It encourages visitors to spend time outdoors and enjoy nature. The main exhibition presents Central Finland's most significant natural sites, with themes such as predators, winter nature, waterways, and forest and swamp nature. In addition to the main exhibition, there are also changing exhibitions. The museum is free to enter and is open from Tuesday to Sunday.

name: Keski-Suomen museo
description:
The Keski-Suomen museo, or Museum of Central Finland, is a cultural history museum located in Jyväskylä. It's situated in the Aalto2 museum center, in a building designed by Alvar Aalto. The museum's exhibitions delve into the history and culture of the Central Finland region.

The museum offers visitors the chance to explore the stories of Central Finland, recall past times, learn new things, and simply marvel. The permanent exhibition introduces visitors to Central Finland and offers even the smallest family members a chance to explore what it means to be from Central Finland. There are opportunities to try creating your own rock painting using modern technology, encounter a mythical bear, and immerse yourself in the life of the past by examining objects and listening to stories.

name: Keuruun museo
description:
Keuruu Museum is an art and cultural history museum located in Keuruu, in the region of Central Finland. It is situated in the old stone barn Kamana, in the old Keuruu area. The museum has been operating in its current form since 2000.

Keuruu Museum organizes varying art and cultural-historical exhibitions in its gallery spaces. It also maintains the local history archive of the Keuruu region and is responsible for the art collection of the city of Keuruu. In addition, you can book a guided tour of the old churches of Keuruu and Pihlajavesi through the museum.

name: Kierikkikeskus
description: Kierikki Stone Age Centre is a science center focused on the Stone Age, grounded in archaeological research. It is located in Yli-Ii, on the northern bank of the Iijoki River, amidst a large Stone Age residential area. At Kierikki, you can explore the ancient past of Northern Ostrobothnia, from the Ice Age to the end of the Stone Age. The center includes an archaeological exhibition and a Stone Age village where visitors can try Stone Age activities like archery and crafting stone tools and explore Stone Age hunting methods. The main building, completed in 2001, showcases Finnish log construction expertise and is one of the largest modern log buildings in the Nordic countries.

name: Kimmo Pyykkö -taidemuseo
description:
The Kimmo Pyykkö Art Museum is located in Kangasala Arts Centre. The museum's permanent exhibition, "A Long-Distance Atelier," showcases the life and career of sculptor Kimmo Pyykkö, from his childhood in Kangasala to his extensive career in the Finnish art scene. Besides the permanent exhibition, the museum has three temporary art exhibitions each year.
The museum also has a museum shop. Guided tours are available for groups upon request. The Kangasala Arts Centre offers accessible facilities, including wheelchair access.

name: Kittilän kotiseutumuseo
description:
Kittilä Local Heritage Museum, also known as Vaaranmikkola, is located in Pakatti, about 4 kilometers from the center of Kittilä, in a scenic location on the banks of the Ounasjoki River. The museum's collections consist mainly of 19th and early 20th-century peasant artifacts from Kittilä, with a collection of nearly 1,000 items.

The museum area consists of buildings placed in the old Peräpohjola-Lapland style. The main building was built in the 1860s, and opposite it is a barn. Other buildings – a stable, a storehouse, a goods shed, a grain shed, a smoke sauna, a toilet, and a storehouse – are located around the yard.

name: Kivikauden kylä
description: Kivikauden kylä, or the Stone Age Village, is located in Saarijärvi, by the beautiful lake Summasjärvi. It's a reconstructed late Stone Age village based on archaeological findings. The village gives you a concrete view of how people lived in ancient times, their dwellings, and tools. It includes Summanen village, Yläkylä, the Ansa path, the Ancient path, and a large exhibit showcasing the Stone Age in Finland. You can explore Stone Age buildings, try archery, or even paddle a log boat. During summer, there are activities for the whole family, where you can learn Stone Age crafts using various materials.

name: Klaavolan talo
description:
Klaavolan talo is a cultural-historical museum in Tuusula. It showcases the everyday life of a wealthy farming estate in the early 1900s. The estate was donated to the municipality of Tuusula in the 20th century. The rooms have been restored to the style of the early 1900s with items from the museum's collections and the Colli family, who previously lived there.

The current main building dates back to the turn of the 18th and 19th centuries. The yard also includes an outbuilding, a shed, a milk room, and a sauna. The outbuilding is newer than the main building, probably from the late 1800s. It served as a servants' cottage and, most recently, as a baking cottage.

name: Kokemäen maatalousmuseo
description:
The Kokemäki Agricultural Museum is a local history museum located in Tulkkila, Kokemäki. It operates in a former granary built in 1838, near the Kokemäki church.

The museum was founded in 1927 by the Kokemäki Local History Association. The museum's basic exhibition is still almost in its original condition, showcasing a wide collection of agricultural tools from different eras. In addition to agricultural items, the museum has tools from various trades, as well as weapon and coin collections. Stone and Iron Age artifacts found in the area are also on display. The museum is open mainly in the summertime, with guided tours available. The building itself is a three-story stone warehouse.

name: Kolttien perinnetalo
description:
The Kolttien Perinnetalo (Skolt Heritage House) is a museum in the village of Sevettijärvi, Inari. It showcases the history and traditions of the Skolt Sámi people. Administered by the Sámi Museum Siida, the Heritage House is an old Skolt house, one of several built by the state in the late 1940s for Skolt Sámi evacuees who were displaced from Petsamo due to the war.

The building reflects Skolt building traditions. Originally built in Kirakkajärvi, the house was moved to its current location in the early 1990s. The main exhibition features artifacts, films, photographs, and texts that tell the story of the Skolt Sámi in the Sevettijärvi–Näätämö area. There is also a museum shop selling Skolt Sámi handicrafts and literature. An open-air museum on the property features a reconstructed Skolt summer village from the Suonikylä era.

name: Koskenjalan kenkä- ja nahkamuseo
description:
The Koskenjalan Kenkä- ja Nahkamuseo (Shoe and Leather Museum) is located in Korkeakoski. It resides in the premises of a former heel and last factory. The museum was opened in 1985. The first shoe factory in Finland started its operations in Korkeakoski in 1897.

The museum's collection features over a thousand pairs of shoes, tools, photographs, and machines, relating stories of the past. There are thematic exhibitions, showcasing work in the factory a century ago and how women's heels have changed over time. The museum also has exhibits on Finnish men's work shoes and resourceful solutions during times of scarcity. A worker's apartment displays modest living during wartime, with both everyday and festive settings. There's also a children's exhibition with shoes from fairytales. Footwear of former presidents is also exhibited.

name: Kotiseututalo Puistola
description: Kotiseututalo Puistola is a local heritage museum located in the church village of Savukoski, in the Lapland region of Finland. The museum features exhibits related to local history and reindeer husbandry in the Kemijoki river valley. During the summer, the museum hires summer employees and is open to the public. The goal is to increase the use of Kotiseututalo Puistola by hosting different events and visits and keep it accessible throughout the year.

name: Kotkaniemi
description:
Kotkaniemi is a rural judge residency located in Luumäki, Finland. It's known for being the long-time home of P. E. Svinhufvud, a former President of Finland. The estate was built in 1898 and later became a museum showcasing the life and times of Svinhufvud and his family.

The Kotkaniemi museum displays original furniture and items from the Svinhufvud era, giving visitors a glimpse into their daily life. The estate includes a main building, side building, sauna, and various other structures. After the deaths of Pehr and Ellen Svinhufvud, the estate was inherited by their youngest child, son Veikko Eivind. He and his wife Aune started a boarding house and after them, the Kotkaniemi boarding house was continued by grandson Jorma and his wife Sirkka. It offers exhibitions and events, providing insight into Finnish history and culture. There's also a nature trail for visitors to explore the surrounding area.

name: Koulumuseo Lagstad
description: Lagstad School Museum is located in Espoo and is part of the KAMU Espoo City Museum. It is located in Espoo's oldest school building. The museum showcases the history of schools in Espoo up to the present day. The school building, completed in 1873, served as a school until 1954. The School Museum Lagstad has been in operation since the 1960s and opened to the public in 2003. Currently, the museum is closed for renovations. The restored school building also hosts the Esbo hembygdsförening. The school exhibition is located in the former classroom on the second floor and continues in a former teacher's apartment in the courtyard building.

name: Kouvolan putkiradiomuseo
description: The Kouvolan Putkiradiomuseo, or Kouvola Radio Museum, consists of three parts. The Home Museum is located in a two-story wooden house with rooms decorated in the style of different decades, and an amateur radio station on the upper floor. In a newer building, you'll find the Radio Museum, which includes a military radio section. The museum showcases the development of radio technology and design from the 1920s to the 1960s, including crystal sets and cabinet radios. The military radio museum has an extensive collection of military radios, including Finnish army radios from wartime and agent radios from the East and West. It is located in the Kaunisnurmi museum quarter, about 500 meters from the railway and bus station.

name: Kruununvankila Vita Björn
description:
Vita Björn is a former Crown Prison located in Kastelholm, Sund, in Åland. Constructed in 1784, it served as a jail for nearly 200 years until 1975. Today, it functions as a prison museum.

The building is divided, with one half serving as the residence for the warden and his family, while the other half contained the prison cells. Originally, there were only three cells, but two more were added in 1839. The prison has been restored to reflect its original appearance.

The museum showcases the evolution of the Finnish penal system from the late 1700s to the 1950s. It is known as the first public prison museum in Finland.

name: Kuddnäs
description:
Kuddnäs is the childhood home of Zachris Topelius, a beloved Finnish author. It is located in Nykarleby and serves as a museum. The museum showcases how the Topelius family, a typical bourgeois family from Ostrobothnia, lived in the early 19th century.

The house features period interiors and objects that belonged to the Topelius family, creating an atmospheric setting that transports visitors back in time. In the house is the chamber where Zachris Topelius was born which still has the cradle. The yellow side building was the location where Zachris and Emilie had their wedding. Nowadays, it is a café, a museum shop, and a banquet hall available for rent.

name: Kuhmalahden kotiseutumuseo
description:
The Kuhmalahti Local Heritage Museum, established in 1973, is located in the village of Kuhmalahti, about 45 kilometers east of Tampere. It showcases local life and cultural history, featuring exhibits about rural life from the 1800s and 1900s, and the local musical heritage.

The museum consists of two buildings and four outbuildings. The main building includes a bakery with a large baking room and two furnished chambers displaying period-style living. The outbuildings display old farm tools. The magazine features an exhibition about the old cooperative and various musical instruments.

name: Kultamuseo
description:
The Gold Museum in Tankavaara, near Inari, is dedicated to the history of gold prospecting and gold production. The museum's story began with just a shoebox of photographs and was officially established in March 1973 by the Lapland Gold Prospectors' Association. It started small but grew over the years, eventually moving to larger buildings.

Today, the Gold Museum is managed by a private foundation and receives state subsidies from Finland. It consists of two architecturally interesting buildings connected by an above-ground mining tunnel, with around 1000 square meters of indoor exhibition space. The museum showcases the history of gold in Lapland and has an international exhibition called "Golden World," featuring the world's largest gold pan.

name: Kuntsin modernin taiteen museo
description: Kuntsin Modern Art Museum is located in Vaasa, Finland. The museum is named after art collector Simo Kuntsi. It focuses on modern and contemporary art, with changing exhibitions and displays from its own collections. The museum's collection includes both international and Finnish modern art, providing an overview of art history with a focus on art from the 1950s onwards. It is located by the sea in the inner harbor. The museum also has a museum shop.

name: Kuokkalan museoraitti
description:
Kuokkalan museoraitti is a museum area maintained jointly by the municipality of Lempäälä and the Lempäälä-Seura association. The first museums opened in 1981, and today there are seven museums. The museum area is located near Kuokkalankoski, about three kilometers from the center of Lempäälä.

A special feature of Kuokkalan museoraitti is that the shop museum is located in a real, former village shop and the forge museum is in an authentic forge. The museum complex also includes a barber-hairdressing museum, a war veterans' heritage chamber, and Kustaa Puskema's smoke shed. The Sakkola Museum, maintained by the Sakkola Foundation, is also located in the area. Guided tours are available.

name: Kuopion kulttuurihistoriallinen museo
description:
The Kuopio Cultural History Museum, founded in 1884, serves as the provincial museum of Northern Savonia. Its mission is to preserve and showcase the cultural history of Kuopio and the surrounding region. The museum's collections, which originated in 1883, cover prehistory, history, folk life, and other aspects of the area's cultural heritage.

Exhibitions are held in multiple locations, including the Kuopio Museum, which features the main exhibits, the Old Kuopio Museum (Kuopion korttelimuseo), and the J.V. Snellman Home Museum. The museum actively promotes the preservation of artifacts and the built environment, playing a vital role in safeguarding the region's cultural heritage.

name: Kuopion luonnontieteellinen museo
description: The Kuopio Natural History Museum helps people understand the diversity of life. Its exhibitions offer new perspectives on Finnish nature. Guidance, workshops, and lectures explore the themes of the exhibitions in more depth. The museum's environmental education events encourage and help expand one's own nature hobby. Excursions to Kuopio's diverse natural sites are an integral part of its environmental education activities. The museum's collections tell of environmental changes over a long period. Research produces information about natural phenomena and the interaction between humans and nature. The museum's plant, fungal, and animal experts provide personal assistance with species identification problems.

name: Kuopion taidemuseo
description:
Kuopio Art Museum is located in the heart of Kuopio, near the cathedral and market square. The museum resides in a former bank building constructed between 1902 and 1904.

The museum focuses on visual art from North Savo, highlighting, documenting, and studying the region's art. Kuopio Art Museum's collection has been growing since 1949 and now includes over 1,900 works and is the regional art museum of North Savo. The museum's collection includes the Osk. Huttunen art collection, which contains 91 works that Huttunen bequeathed to the city of Kuopio.

name: Kurun ulkomuseo
description:
Kurun Ulkomuseo is located in a depression called Hoppasojan notkelma, near the Keihäslahden school and Kurun sports hall. The museum's most well-known attraction is Vänrikki Stoolin tupa (Ensign Stål's croft). Ensign Polviander once lived in the croft, and J. L. Runeberg got ideas for his poetry collections from stories heard there.

The museum was founded in the 1960s with the goal of showcasing past life and preserving buildings, artifacts, and traditions for future generations. The buildings have been moved to the museum area from their original locations. The museum area has a total of six buildings, which display artifacts related to the life of the olden days.

name: Kuurojen museo
description:
The Deaf Museum preserves the cultural heritage of Finnish deaf and sign language users. It operates as part of the Finnish Labour Museum Werstas. The Deaf Museum's collections and office are located in Tampere at the Werstas premises, but a new exhibition opened in Helsinki in October 2024.

The museum aims to increase awareness of the history and culture of deaf people and sign language users and strengthen their identity. The museum's diverse collections serve researchers and other interested parties. The museum's basic exhibition presents the life of C.O. Malm, the founder of deaf education in Finland. The history of the sign language community is presented in changing exhibitions.

name: Kymenlaakson museo
description:
The Kymenlaakso Museum is located in Kotka, specifically in the Maritime Centre Vellamo. It serves as the regional museum for Kymenlaakso and the city museum for Kotka. The museum's collections include objects, photographs, and documents that offer a diverse look into the life of Kotka and the Kymenlaakso region.

The museum features both cultural history and fine art exhibitions. The Maritime Museum, which is a collaboration with the Border Guard, is also part of the Kymenlaakso Museum. The exhibitions delve into various themes, and there are public lectures and events. The Kymenlaakso Museum provides expert services and advice related to cultural heritage.

name: Lahden historiallinen museo
description:
Located in a pink manor house in the center of Lahti, the Historical Museum of Lahti presents the cultural history of Lahti and Päijät-Häme from the Ice Age to the present day. The museum offers modern museum exhibitions in a historical setting.

The main exhibition "Hyvä paikka" (Good Place) tells the history of everyday life in Päijät-Häme from the Ice Age to the present. Another exhibition, "Kotiin - Karjalan kaikuja ja kuvia" (Home - Echoes and Images of Karelia), explores the experience of losing one's home and the memories that accompany people. The museum also features a permanent "Asehuone" (Armory) exhibition with weapons from different eras.

name: Lahden kaupunginmuseo
description: Lahden kaupunginmuseo, also known as Lahti Museums, encompasses several museums in Lahti. These include technical museums like the Radio and TV Museum and the Ski Museum, as well as the Historical Museum, the Poster Museum, and the Art Museum. The Historical Museum, located in a pink manor house in the city center, showcases the cultural history of Lahti and Päijät-Häme from the Ice Age to the present day. It features the permanent "Hyvä Paikka" (Good Place) exhibition and rotating exhibits like "Kotiin - Karjalan kaikuja ja kuvia" (Home - Echoes and Images of Karelia). The museum collects, preserves, researches, exhibits, and publishes historical artifacts related to its area.

name: Lahden taidemuseo
description:
Lahti Art Museum was a regional art museum in Lahti, Finland, founded in 1950. However, it has merged with the Lahti Museum of Visual Arts Malva. Malva is located in a former brewery building built in 1912 in the Malski area and opened to the public in April 2022.

Malva features art, poster, and design exhibitions. It aims to offer diverse museum experiences through quality exhibitions, digital content, and services. Malva also collaborates with art museums in Orimattila and Heinola, extending its services to municipalities, associations, parishes, and individuals in the Päijät-Häme region.

name: Langinkosken keisarillinen kalastusmaja
description:
The Langinkoski Imperial Fishing Lodge is a villa built for Emperor Alexander III of Russia, completed in 1889. Magnus Schjerfbeck designed it. After Finland gained independence, the lodge was transferred to the state and used as a summer residence for senators and ministers. It became a museum in 1933, and in 2018, it came under the Finnish National Museum's authority.

Emperor Alexander III first visited Langinkoski in 1880 when he was crown prince. During his second visit, he expressed his desire for a small fishing lodge on the riverbank. The building's construction began in the summer of 1888, and it was inaugurated the following year. The building showcases Swiss style and Karelian log architecture. Besides the main building, there is a small chapel, a fish hatchery, a fisherman's cottage, and a fishing equipment shed.

name: Lapin maakuntamuseo
description:
The Lapin Maakuntamuseo, located in Rovaniemi's Arktikum building, serves as the regional museum for Finnish Lapland, excluding Tornionlaakso, Kemi region, and the Sami native region in cultural environment tasks. It focuses on collecting, preserving, and researching cultural and natural history materials from the area.

The museum's collections, including artifacts, photographs, archives, and natural science specimens, are available for researchers and the public. Staff provides information on the region's history, built heritage, culture, archaeology, and natural sciences. The main exhibition showcases the history and nature of Rovaniemi, Peräpohjola, and the Sami area of Upper Lapland, including a section on the history of Petsamo. Special exhibitions and events are organized annually.

name: Lapin metsämuseo
description:
Lapin Metsämuseo, or the Lapland Forest Museum, is located in Rovaniemi. It preserves and showcases the cultural heritage related to forestry in Lapland. The museum tells the story of the great logging era in Lapland, starting from the 1870s and continuing until the mechanization of forestry in the 1960s and 70s.

The museum area features authentic lumberjack cabins, forestry equipment, timber floating equipment, and forestry machines. These buildings have been relocated from various parts of Lapland, and each cabin, stable, and sauna has its own interesting history. The museum's collections include around 3,000 artifacts and 43,000 photographs. Guided tours are available by appointment outside of the museum's opening hours.

name: Lappajärven museo
description:
The Lappajärvi Museum is located in the former courthouse of Lappajärvi. The building was originally built as the main building of a farmhouse in Soini between 1790 and 1800. In the 1840s, it was moved to its current location to serve as a common house for the municipalities of Evijärvi, Kortesjärvi, Lappajärvi, and Vimpeli. It functioned as a courthouse from the 1840s until the 1970s.

The museum features exhibitions about the local congregation, war veterans, the folk school, and the Lappajärvi Veikot sports club. During the summer, there are also changing exhibitions. The Lappajärvi Society manages the museum. In the summer of 2024, the museum was open during July.

name: Lappeenrannan museot
description: Lappeenranta has several museums, including the South Karelia Museum, which showcases Karelian life and traditions, the Lappeenranta Art Museum, and the Cavalry Museum. These museums are located in the Lappeenranta Fortress, within old barracks and warehouse buildings along Kristiinankatu street. The old military buildings from the Russian period have been converted into museums over the decades. Additionally, the Wolkoff House Museum and, during the summer, the Saimaa Canal Museum and the Karelian Aviation Museum are also open to visitors.

name: Lappeenrannan taidemuseo
description:
The Lappeenranta Art Museum is situated in the Lappeenranta Fortress, specifically in the neo-classical barracks constructed in 1798, across from the Orthodox Church. It serves as the regional art museum for Southeast Finland.

The museum's collection primarily showcases Finnish fine art from the 19th century to the present day. A significant portion of the collection comes from the Viipuri Art Friends Society. Acquisitions for the museum particularly focus on art originating from Southeast Finland.

Exhibitions at the Lappeenranta Art Museum comprehensively explore various artistic phenomena, with a strong emphasis on contemporary art. However, older art is also regularly featured. In addition to exhibitions, the museum provides guided tours, events, and workshops. A museum shop is also located within the premises, offering unique items inspired by the museum's collections.

name: Lauri Viita -museo
description:
The Lauri Viita Museum is located in Tampere, in the district of Pispala. It's dedicated to the author Lauri Viita and is located in his childhood home. The house was built by Lauri Viita's father and his mother's father at the turn of the century.

The museum showcases Viita's life and the working-class life in Pispala during the 1920s and 1930s. The flat, consisting of a kitchen and a chamber, is presented in its original style. The museum is maintained by the Lauri Viita Society and the building is owned by the local heritage foundation Pispalan Moreeni ry. You can visit the museum during summer weekends or by appointment throughout the year. There is also a small museum shop.

name: Lavian kotiseutumuseo
description:
Lavian Kotiseutumuseo is a local museum showcasing the life, traditions, and crafts of Lavia. It is located in a former granary built in 1853. The building was converted into a museum in 1954, and the actual museum operations and collection began in 1957.

The museum primarily exhibits items related to agriculture and household activities, including tools and equipment. Additionally, it features objects related to fishing, hunting, and church life. A stone and mineral collection donated by a local enthusiast, Antti Kamppi, is also on display, featuring lavialite, a rock named after Lavia. The museum preserves and presents the cultural heritage, also aiming to keep the spirit of Lavia alive.

name: Lenin-museo
description:
The Lenin Museum, located in Tampere, Finland, was dedicated to Vladimir Lenin. Established in 1946, it was the first Lenin museum outside the Soviet Union. The museum was situated in the Tampere Workers' Hall, where Lenin and Stalin first met in 1905.

The exhibitions covered Lenin's life, the Russian Revolution, and Finnish-Soviet relations. In April 2024, it was announced that the museum would close in November 2024 and reopen in February 2025 as "Nootti, the Museum of Finnish-Russian Relations", focusing on the relationship between Finland and Russia. The new museum will operate within Tampere's historic Workers' Hall.

name: Lepikon torppa
description:
Lepikon torppa is the birthplace of former Finnish President Urho Kekkonen. Located in Pielavesi, it was originally built in the 1860s as a small croft.

In 1900, Kekkonen's father, Juho, bought the croft, and the family lived there for six years. During that time, the house was renovated, with a proper stove and chimney replacing the old smoke stove and new windows added.

Lepikon torppa has significant historical value and was restored in the 1960s as a museum. It is furnished to reflect the early 1900s, including some original Kekkonen family items. Today, it is a popular tourist destination.

name: Liedon Vanhalinna
description:
Liedon Vanhalinna, also known as the Old Castle of Lieto, is a historically significant site in Finland. It features a hillfort that rises 55 meters above sea level. Archaeological excavations reveal that the site was used during the Late Bronze Age and the Middle Iron Age.

The area also includes a manor house which serves as a museum, showcasing archaeological finds from various eras. The estate, with its beautiful buildings, is owned by the University of Turku. Vanhalinna is located by the Aura river valley, near the Linnavuori hill, and it attracts many visitors every year. It's a popular destination for events and offers a glimpse into Finland's ancient past.

name: Loimaan kotiseutumuseo
description:
Loimaan kotiseutumuseo is located in a granary built in 1855, on the Kanta-Loimaa church hill. The granary, constructed of natural stone blocks, originally served as a loan granary. In 1955, the local municipal council donated the empty granary to the Loimaa-Seura association for use as a local history museum.

The museum was opened to the public in 1962 and currently holds approximately 4,500 items. The museum's main exhibition is spread over three floors. The exhibition showcases local life, starting from an old "pirtti" (traditional Finnish living room) on the ground floor, progressing through everyday bread and household activities, to agriculture, crafts, and their equipment. In the summer of 2024, the museum features an exhibition about photography studios and photographers from Loimaa.

name: Louhisaaren kartano
description:
Louhisaari Manor is a baroque manor house located in Askainen, in the municipality of Masku, Southwest Finland. It is one of the best-preserved manor environments in Finland, surrounded by an English-style park. The main building and outbuildings were completed in 1655. The manor was owned by the Fleming family from around 1450 to 1791 and by the Mannerheim family from 1795 to 1903. It is the birthplace of Marshal Carl Gustaf Emil Mannerheim.

The manor represents rare palatial architecture in Finland. Its festive and service floors are in 17th-century style, while the middle floor, the actual living area, was renovated in the 18th and 19th centuries. The manor came into the possession of the Finnish state in 1961 and was opened to the public as a museum in 1967.

name: Luonnontieteellinen keskusmuseo
description:
The Finnish Museum of Natural History (Luonnontieteellinen keskusmuseo), also known as Luomus, is a research institution under the University of Helsinki. It maintains Finland's national collections of botany, zoology, geology, and paleontology.

The museum has three public locations. The Natural History Museum on Pohjoinen Rautatiekatu showcases the diversity of Finnish and global nature. The Kaisaniemi Botanic Garden features greenhouses and an outdoor garden. The Kumpula Botanic Garden is open from May to September.

The Natural History Museum's exhibitions explore the history of life and the impacts of climate change. The museum also has a cafe and a shop.

name: Luonnontieteellinen museo (Helsinki)
description:
The Natural History Museum, part of the Finnish Museum of Natural History, is located on Pohjoinen Rautatiekatu 13 in Helsinki. The museum's building has been part of the Helsinki cityscape for over a century.

Inside, visitors can explore diverse exhibitions showcasing Finnish and global nature. These include "Finnish Nature," "History of Life," and "Changing Climate." The exhibitions feature animals in their natural habitats, skeletons, and interactive displays. The museum also addresses climate change and its impact, prompting reflection on the future. A cafe and museum shop are available for visitors. The museum is easily accessible by public transport.

name: Luontotalo Arkki
description:
Luontotalo Arkki, located in Pori, is a natural history museum that focuses on the nature of Satakunta and the Bothnian Sea. The museum is a popular destination for families with children. The main exhibition showcases local nature sites, animals, and plants.

Inside, children can enjoy a lighthouse, a bird tower, and a bear den. The museum also features a butterfly room with Finnish and tropical butterflies that opens upon request. Outside, the Kivipiha Jotuni area introduces visitors to the bedrock of Satakunta. The museum is open from Tuesday to Sunday, 11 AM to 5 PM.

name: Luostarinmäen käsityöläismuseo
description:
Luostarinmäki Handicrafts Museum is an open-air museum located in Turku. It consists of 18 blocks of original 18th and early 19th-century buildings in their original location. The area was the only old residential area to survive the Great Fire of Turku in 1827.

The museum showcases the workshops and homes of pre-industrial urban artisans. During the summer, artisans demonstrate traditional crafts. The staff dress in period costumes from the 1800s. The museum aims to preserve the history and skills of old handicrafts.

name: Lusto – metsämuseo
description:
Lusto, the Finnish Forest Museum, is a national museum dedicated to forestry and forest culture, located in Punkaharju. The museum's name, "Lusto," refers to the annual growth ring of a tree. It showcases the relationship between Finns and their forests through exhibitions and events.

The museum's exhibits cover various aspects of forests, including biodiversity, myths, the history of forest settlements, and forestry technology. The main exhibition, "Land of Forest Relations", tells about the ancient relationship between forest and man through six perspectives. Visitors can explore a wide collection of forestry-related items, including large forestry machines. Lusto aims to provide insight into the importance of forests in Finnish life.

name: Länsi-Uudenmaan maakuntamuseo
description:
Länsi-Uudenmaan Maakuntamuseo (West Uusimaa Provincial Museum) is located in Tammisaari, Raasepori. It was founded in 1906. The museum aims to increase understanding and knowledge of its area through its collections and activities, contributing to the development of society.

The museum operates in several locations, including the Tammisaari Museum Centre EKTA, which features a modern exhibition building with the museum's main exhibition, a ticket office, a café, and a museum shop. EKTA also includes the Porvaristalo (Burgher's House) and the Valokuvaamo (Photography Museum), which showcase historical interiors. The museum also manages the Leira Collection Centre and the Forngården House Museum in Snappertuna.

name: Lönnströmin taidemuseo
description:
The Lönnström Art Museum is a private art museum in Rauma, owned by the Lönnström Foundation. Founded in 1993, it is located in a stone building in the city center, designed by architect Onni von Zansen and completed in 1912.

Initially the building was a private home, then a hotel, police station and town hall. The Lönnström Foundation purchased the building in 1991 and renovated it into a modern art museum. The museum organizes changing exhibitions of Finnish and international art, focusing on Finnish contemporary art. Since 2016, the museum has been known for its contemporary art projects in collaboration with visual artists.

name: M/S Bore
description:
M/S Bore is a museum, hotel, and restaurant ship permanently docked in Turku, Finland, along the Aura River near Forum Marinum. Originally built in 1960 as a steamship at Oskarshamn shipyard in Sweden, it initially served as a car and passenger ferry for Bore Steamship Company. The ship was unique as the first ferry that allowed cars to drive aboard on the route between Finland and Sweden.

Later known as S/S Borea, it was converted into a cruise ship in 1988 and renamed Kristina Regina, operating as such until 2010. In that year, Kristina Cruises sold the ship, and it was returned to its original name, Bore, and placed in Turku. Since 2018, it has also served as a learning environment for students of Turku Vocational Institute.

name: Maitolaiturimuseo
description:
Maitolaiturimuseo is located in Tampere, in the village of Velaatta, along road 338 leading from Tampere to Ruovesi. It is known as one of the smallest museums in Europe, and possibly the only milk depot museum in the world. 

The museum is dedicated to Finnish rural history and culture, aiming to bridge the gap between urban and rural populations. It presents both current and historical themes of interest to both groups. The museum's exhibitions vary each year and the site is open 24/7 during the summer months, typically from June to early October. The exhibitions have explored topics like the importance of cow's milk, the evacuation of cows during the war, and even a space center. A blue cow sculpture is a notable landmark nearby.

name: Majakkalaiva Kemi
description:
Majakkalaiva Kemi is Finland's last operating lightship. It is the only one of the eighteen lightships that served in Finland that has been preserved as a museum ship. The ship was built in 1900–1901 at the Pori Machine Workshop. When completed, it was named Nya Äransgrund.

The lightship has had several names, which have been changed each time its location changed. From 1960, Kemi was the only lightship serving in Finland. In 1975, it was replaced by a fixed bottom lighthouse. In 2022, the lightship Kemi was opened to the public at the Merikeskus Vellamo dock in Kotka. Its original steam engine has been preserved.

name: Malkkimuseo
description:
Malkkimuseo is a private art museum located in the Kaakinmaa district of Tampere. It was founded in 1991 and exhibits primarily Finnish contemporary art. The museum's collection, which focuses on art from the 1980s to the 2000s, is based on the collection of gallerist Ismo Malkki and painter Virpi Malkki and contains over 500 works.

The museum is situated in the historic Klingendahl property, in a building completed in 1896 that originally served as a spinning mill founded by Fabian Klingendahl. The exhibition space is located at Papinkatu 21. Visits are possible by appointment.

name: Mannerheim-museo
description:
The Mannerheim Museum, located in Helsinki, is dedicated to preserving the life and times of Marshal C.G.E. Mannerheim. It resides in Mannerheim's former home in the Kaivopuisto district, where he lived from 1924 to 1951. The museum aims to showcase his life and the history of Finland.

With the exception of a few rooms converted for exhibitions, the house remains in its original state, offering an authentic glimpse into Mannerheim's life. Visitors can explore exhibits featuring his collection of medals, hunting trophies, books, gifts, and portraits. The museum provides guided tours in multiple languages, and advance booking is highly recommended. The museum is temporarily closed for renovations.

name: Marela
description:
Based on the latitude and longitude, it is likely that you are referring to Liisa Marela, who works as a building engineer for municipal technical services in the town of Raisio.
She is involved in the maintenance, summer upkeep, winter maintenance, streets, parks and playgrounds. She can be reached by email at liisa.marela@raisio.fi or by mobile phone. She works at the town hall.

name: Marttilan kirkkomuseo
description: The Marttila Church Museum is located in Marttila, Finland. It showcases the history of the local church and parish. The current church was designed by Antti Piimänen, incorporating stones from previous sacristy foundations. A late Baroque bell tower stands at the west end. The altar painting was created by court painter R.W. Ekman. One notable exhibit is a small "häpeäpenkki" or pillory, a seat of shame used to publicly humiliate wrongdoers. The museum provides insights into the religious and social life of the community throughout the centuries.

name: Maskun museo
description:
Masku Museum, founded in 1974, is located in the village of Humikkala, about 300 meters southeast of Masku Church. The museum's collection mainly consists of peasant artifacts, totaling around 1600 items. In addition, the museum has a collection of over 450 books and magazines.

The museum building dates back to the 1840s and has changed over the years. Originally, it was a double-roomed house with a saddle roof. Later, the house received an additional wing and a neoclassical appearance with a hipped roof. The museum grounds include two outbuildings dating back to the mid-1800s. These outbuildings were renovated in the early 1990s and serve as exhibition and storage space for the museum.

In the past, the building served as an inn. The museum is open during the summer, and admission is free.

name: Mediamuseo Rupriikki
description:
Mediamuseo Rupriikki is a cultural history museum in Tampere, Finland, dedicated to the history of mass communication and media.

The museum, established in 2001 and opened to the public in 2003, is located in the Vapriikki Museum Centre. It explores the evolution of media through the lens of Tampere's own media expertise. Visitors can explore the transformations of information networks, the history of the internet, and early forms of digital communication. The museum also showcases the history of gaming.

name: Median museo ja arkisto Merkki
description:
Merkki, formerly known as the Päivälehden Museo, is a museum and archive dedicated to media. It's a space open to everyone interested in exploring communication phenomena and the history of news. Located in a former newspaper building in central Helsinki, Merkki's exhibitions showcase media from printing presses to internet memes. The museum aims to increase people's understanding of each other and encourage responsible communication.

Merkki organizes exhibitions and events related to communication and makes the latest research findings in the field of communication accessible to everyone. The archive preserves Finnish media history spanning over a century, supporting research and providing insights for the public. The museum collects items related to newspaper production and journalistic work.

name: Merenkurkun luontokeskus Terranova
description:
Terranova Nature Center of the Kvarken Archipelago is located in Vaasa, within the Ostrobothnian Museum. It offers an introduction to the unique nature of the Kvarken Archipelago, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

The center provides information about the area's birds, allows visitors to "pet" a seal, and offers a peek into a virtual aquarium filled with fish. You can also explore the insect chamber to see local butterfly species and touch ancient rocks in the stone exhibit. Terranova serves as a starting point for those interested in the Kvarken Archipelago's natural trails and events.

name: Merimiehenkotimuseo
description:
The Merimiehenkotimuseo, or the Sailor's Home Museum, is located in Pikisaari, Oulu. It is situated in Matila House, the oldest wooden building in the city.

Originally built in the 1730s as a customs house, it was later moved to Pikisaari. The museum showcases the life of Oulu sailors in the 19th century. It features furnishings and objects typical of a sailor's home from the late 1800s. The museum also delves into the history of Pikisaari and the Matila House itself. You can explore the exhibits to learn about maritime Oulu and the lives of the sailors who once called it home. In the museum shop you can buy tar, soaps and other themed products.

name: Miinan mökki
description:
Miinan Mökki is a building located in Sammatti. It's named after Miina Lönnrot, Elias Lönnrot's niece, who lived there in her old age after Elias Lönnrot passed away. The cottage, originally named Rauhala, was built in 1863 by Karl Westerholm, Elias Lönnrot's eldest brother's son-in-law.

Nowadays, the building is owned by the Sammattiseura association. During the summer, it hosts handicraft and art exhibitions. The cottage features a main room and two chambers, suitable for arranging summer exhibitions. The main room has hanging rails and spotlights for paintings, and rag rugs and old furniture create a cozy atmosphere.

name: Mikkelin taidemuseo
description:
The Mikkeli Art Museum is a regional art museum in Mikkeli, Finland. It started in 1970 as the Johannes Haapasalo Museum. In 1976, after receiving Martti Airio's art collection as a donation, its name was changed to the Mikkeli Art Museum. Since the beginning of 2020, the Mikkeli Art Museum has been responsible for the regional art museum duties in the South Savo region.

The museum focuses on exhibiting South Savo art, managing its art collections, and presenting Finnish illustration art. The art museum has several changing exhibitions every year. From 1970 to 2018, the art museum operated in the granite building designed by Armas Rankka, which was built in 1912. Since June 2019, the art museum has been operating in temporary premises on the second floor of the Akseli shopping center.

name: Milavida
description: Milavida is a museum in Tampere located in Näsilinna palace. It offers a glimpse into the life of the Nottbeck family, who owned the Finlayson cotton mill, showcasing their cosmopolitan lifestyle. Besides the main exhibition about the Nottbecks, Milavida features changing exhibitions focusing on fashion and design. Currently, there is an exhibition called "Bravissimo! Splendour of Teatro dell'Opera di Roma costumes" running from April 26th, displaying costumes from the Roman Opera. There is also a cafe in the same building, called Kahvila Milavida.

name: Mobilia
description:
Mobilia is the Finnish national museum for road transport, located in Kangasala, near Tampere. It showcases the history of Finnish road transport through various exhibitions. The museum features both permanent and annually changing exhibits, including a Rally Museum.

Visitors can explore Finnish road history, admire classic vehicles, and delve into the world of rally racing. In the summertime, children can learn about traffic safety in a dedicated traffic park. Mobilia also offers a museum shop, café, and meeting facilities. The museum is open year-round and welcomes around 45,000 visitors annually, making it a popular destination for families, car enthusiasts, and event organizers.

name: Moision sairaalamuseo
description: Moision sairaalamuseo was located in Mikkeli and displayed the history and artifacts of the former mental hospital, which was founded in 1927. The museum showcased a wide range of treatments used in the hospital, as well as the recreational opportunities and activities available to patients. All the objects on display in the museum were used in the Moisio hospital. The museum's collection included over 3,500 items. Guides in the hospital museum were former hospital employees. The hospital closed at the beginning of 2023, and the psychiatric services moved to new facilities in the center of Mikkeli. The hospital museum itself was open from 1987 to 2021, and unfortunately, it is now permanently closed.

name: Muistokoti Aappola
description:
Muistokoti Aappola is a memorial home dedicated to Abraham Ojanperä, a significant Finnish opera singer and vocal pedagogue born in Liminka. It is a key part of the Old Liminka museum area. The building itself is an artist's villa and consists of two parts: an old, low section built in the late 1800s, and a tower-like new section built in 1910.

The house museum showcases the life and legacy of the singer, displaying a significant portion of his belongings. The interior is remarkably preserved, reflecting the colorful, artistic, and European-influenced style of the early 1900s, with its wallpapers, carpets, curtains, and furniture.

name: Murtovaaran talomuseo
description:
Murtovaara House Museum is located in North Karelia and is Finland's only hill-farm settlement museum. It is located remotely, with the final stretch to the museum requiring a walk along a cart path.

The museum area consists of 16 log buildings from different centuries, the oldest dating back to the 1840s. The buildings and artifacts are original and were created and preserved in the house. The museum tells the story of hill-farm settlement and how people lived in the past. The last resident of the farm left in 1985, but it has been a museum since 1972.

name: Museo-Galleria Alariesto
description:
The Museo-Galleria Alariesto is located in the center of Sodankylä, near the old church. It was opened in July 1986 and features a permanent exhibition of the artistic work of Andreas Alariesto (1900-1989). The collection includes 100 paintings, a miniature sculpture "A Lappish Village," and items related to his life.

Alariesto's paintings depict visualized stories from his childhood, some true and some fictional, portraying the life of the people with colorful, genuine touches, reflecting a world that is gone forever. From September 2020, the Kauko Sorjonen Foundation has been in charge of the museum.

name: Museokeskus Vapriikki
description:
Museokeskus Vapriikki is a versatile museum center located by the Tammerkoski rapids in Tampere. It offers a variety of exhibitions for the whole family, with themes including history, technology, and natural sciences.

Vapriikki is home to several museums, including the Natural History Museum of Tampere, the Media Museum Rupriikki, the Mineral Museum, the Finnish Hockey Hall of Fame, the Postal Museum, and the Finnish Museum of Games. The museum center is housed in the old Tampella factory hall, with the oldest parts dating back to the 1880s. Visitors can also enjoy the museum restaurant Valssi and the Vapriikki museum shop.

name: Muumimuseo
description:
The Moomin Museum is an experiential art museum that appeals to Moomin and visual art enthusiasts of all ages. The museum is home to Tove Jansson's original illustrations.

The Moomin Museum is based on Tove Jansson's unique Moomin art collection, which was donated to the Tampere Art Museum in 1986. Tove Jansson and her life partner, graphic artist Tuulikki Pietilä, donated their art collection to the Tampere Art Museum in 1986. The Moomin Valley Collection of the Tampere Art Museum includes a total of about two thousand works dating from the 1930s to the 1990s.

The museum experience is complemented by the Tampere Hall's cozy Restaurant Tuhto, the Moomin Museum's reading library, and the shop.

name: Myllysaaren museo
description:
Myllysaaren museo is located in an old paper mill in Valkeakoski, along a beautiful canal. The permanent exhibition, Vana, tells the story of the region's history from prehistoric times to the present day. The exhibition brings people from the past to life, and the region's strong industrial tradition plays a big part. There are also several temporary exhibitions each year.

You can also visit the Finnish Football Museum in Myllysaari. A special feature of the museum is an authentic Venetian gondola, which was acquired by the factory manager Juuso Walden in 1963. The gondola is located in the Myllysaari restaurant hall and can be viewed when the restaurant is open. The museum also features a shop where you can buy local products and souvenirs.

name: Mynämäen kirkkomuseo
description: Mynämäki Church Museum is likely located within the Mynämäki Church (Pyhän Laurin kirkko), a medieval stone church in the municipality of Mynämäki. The church is dedicated to Saint Lawrence and Saint Eric and is the second largest medieval gray stone church in Finland. Mynämäki Church was first mentioned in surviving documents as a parish in 1309, with the church itself located in the parish around the middle of the same century. The sacristy of the medieval stone church was built before the main nave. The church's fixed interior was renewed and the windows were enlarged in 1865. The church was restored to its current appearance in a restoration designed by architect Olli Kestilä in 1959-1960.

name: Myrskylän kotiseutumuseo
description:
Myrskylä Local Museum is located in a nationally significant cultural environment, specifically in a 19th-century granary on the old church hill. This hill has been a religious center since the 17th century and maintains its 1800s appearance.

Inside the museum, you can explore exhibits about prehistory and wartime life in Myrskylä. The upper floor showcases different types of traditional work, such as the journey of grain from field to beer. The museum's collection largely consists of tools and items related to the agricultural year, dating back to the 19th and early 20th centuries. The oldest item is a Bible from the 1600s.

name: Naantalin museo
description:
Naantali Museum illuminates the fascinating history of the monastery town. Located in the Old Town, the museum consists of two wooden buildings that offer an interesting glimpse into Naantali's past. The history of Naantali, founded in 1443 in connection with the Bridgettine Convent, is intertwined with the monastery, the spa, and its location near Turku and the archipelago.

The museum comprises two buildings: Humppi and Hiilola. Humppi houses an archaeological exhibition of Naantali's earliest days, a miniature model of the Bridgettine Convent, and changing theme exhibitions. Hiilola showcases the interiors of a 19th-century middle-class small-town home. The museum also features a garden with a herb garden and a children's playhouse.

name: Nastolan kotiseutumuseo
description:
Nastolan kotiseutumuseo is a local museum located in Nastola, near the Nastola church. It consists of a storehouse built in 1845 and the Kopoo house, which was moved from Ruuhijärvi.

The museum was founded in 1958. The museum's collection includes items from the neolithic age and mainly peasant artifacts from the time of autonomy. The museum is open for groups during the summer season, and visits can be arranged with the Lahti Museums. The museum aims to showcase the rich heritage and cultural identity of the Nastola area, providing visitors with a unique opportunity to explore the traditions, lifestyle, and history of this charming community.

name: Nelimarkka-museo
description:
The Nelimarkka Museum, established in 1964 by Finnish painter and art professor Eero Nelimarkka, is located in Alajärvi. Today, it serves as both a museum dedicated to Nelimarkka's work and the regional art museum of Southern Ostrobothnia.

In addition to showcasing Eero Nelimarkka's art, the museum features contemporary art by Finnish and international artists. The museum provides various services, including guided tours for school groups, public events, and workshops.

The museum complex also includes Villa Väinölä, designed by Alvar Aalto, which hosts Nelimarkka's artist residency program and exhibits of local art. The Nelimarkka Museum plays a vital role in promoting art and culture in the Southern Ostrobothnia region.

name: Nordean pankkimuseo
description: The Nordea Bank Museum is located at Aleksanterinkatu 36 B in Helsinki. It resides within the former Union Bank of Finland's Old Banking Hall. The museum showcases a culturally significant bank interior designed by the architectural firm Gesellius, Lindgren & Saarinen, dating back to 1904, complete with its original furniture. Visitors can view part of the banking hall and the director's office. The displays are enhanced by banking artifacts from various commercial banks. The museum's open days are typically on the first Thursday of each month. It is also open for groups of 10-20 people on weekdays by appointment.

name: Nurmon museo
description:
The Nurmo Museum, maintained by the Nurmoo-Seura association, is a local history museum. The main building, formerly the Yli-Teppo or Mäki-Teppo house, is located near the Nurmonjoki river. Several other buildings have been moved to the site.

The two-story main building was constructed in 1796 and has an interesting history, having housed figures such as the outlaw Isontalon Antti. The museum complex includes other relocated structures such as a storehouse, a workshop, and a cabin. A wartime shelter on the grounds was used by residents during air raids. The museum also displays the Nurmo coat of arms.

name: Nykytaiteen museo Kiasma
description:
Kiasma Museum of Contemporary Art, located in the heart of Helsinki, is a prominent museum showcasing modern art. Designed by American architect Steven Holl, the avant-garde building is a work of art itself, emphasizing the fusion of light, space, and form. Kiasma houses over 8,000 Finnish and international works from the 1960s onwards.

The museum hosts innovative temporary exhibitions and explores significant movements in contemporary art. As part of the Finnish National Gallery, Kiasma plays a key role in developing and promoting contemporary art in the Nordic countries. The architecturally unique building also includes a library, museum shop, and restaurant. It is a meeting place for art and people and welcomes everyone.

name: Näkövammaismuseo
description:
The Museum of Visual Impairment is a specialized museum in Helsinki, focusing on disability history. It was founded in 1991 and is maintained by the Finnish Federation of the Visually Impaired.

The museum's collections include objects, photographs, documents, audio and video recordings, member magazines, and books. These collections comprehensively illustrate the history and development of blind education, traditional professions, information acquisition, everyday aids, and organizational work for the visually impaired, from the mid-1800s to the present day.

In the renovated permanent exhibition "Centuries of Work for the Visually Impaired," visitors can explore relief maps, Braille materials, and tools. They can also try Braille writing with old instruments and test simulation glasses to experience different degrees of visual impairment. Audio programs addressing visual impairment from different decades are also available.

name: Olavinlinna
description:
Olavinlinna, also known as St. Olaf's Castle, is a 15th-century castle located in Savonlinna, Finland. It stands on a rocky island in the Kyrönsalmi strait, which connects lakes Haukivesi and Pihlajavesi. Founded in 1475 by Erik Axelsson Tott, a Danish-born knight, it was intended as a military stronghold to protect the Savo region from eastern Russian attacks and secure the area for the Swedish Crown.

The castle has a rich history, having withstood several sieges. Today, Olavinlinna is a popular tourist attraction that hosts various events throughout the year, including the Savonlinna Opera Festival during the summer. Visitors can take guided tours to explore the castle's architecture and learn about its past. The castle also houses small exhibitions, including the Castle Museum and Orthodox Museum.

name: Oulun Automuseo
description:
Oulun Automuseo is located south of Oulu, in the Kiviniemi district. It has been in its current location since 1986 and is maintained by Oulun Seudun Mobilistit ry. The building showcases Finnish wood construction expertise and its exterior is protected in the local plan.

The museum displays around 60 vehicles, with the oldest dating back to the 1910s. You can find cars, motorcycles, various engines, miniature models, photos, and literature. The museum often has a different theme every spring. The museum building's shape resembles a Ford A model's wheel. There is also a lunch cafe called Lounaskahvila Biili in the same building.

name: Oulun taidemuseo
description: Oulu Art Museum is a northern museum of contemporary art. The museum focuses on regionalism and contemporary art in its exhibitions, not forgetting collection and theme exhibitions, and internationality. In addition to the exhibitions, there is also an event program. The museum's collection is focused on contemporary art. Thematic entities include various phenomena of visual arts, artists' self-portraits, naive art, and northernness. The museum maintains the Oulu City Collection and manages several smaller donation collections. It is located in the Myllytulli district, close to Hupisaaret park.

name: Oulunsalon kotiseutumuseo
description:
Oulunsalon kotiseutumuseo is located next to the church on Lentokentäntie. At the museum, visitors can explore local life in Oulunsalo in the late 1800s and early 1900s.

The museum area consists of six buildings: the main building, Kukkosen talo, a woodshed, a storehouse, an outbuilding, a threshing barn, and Päiviki's storehouse. Most of the buildings are in their original locations, or have been moved short distances.

On display are items and tools needed on farms, from agricultural work to cupping. In addition to agriculture, fishing has always been practiced in Oulunsalo. There are approximately 1200 items in the Oulunsalo Local History Museum's collection.

name: Outokummun kaivosmuseo
description:
The Outokumpu Mining Museum is located in the Old Mine area and showcases the mining history of Outokumpu and Finland from the early 1900s to the present day. The museum features various exhibitions, including underground mine tunnels that realistically demonstrate the mining environment, a mineral exhibition called "Earth's Treasures," and an exhibition explaining the end products of mining.

Visitors can explore large mining machines and equipment. The mine tunnels, extending 277 meters in length and descending to a depth of 50 meters, offer an exciting and educational experience in a historical setting. The museum was opened in 1982 in a former mining building.

name: Paikkarin torppa
description:
Paikkarin torppa is the birthplace of Elias Lönnrot, the compiler of the Finnish national epic, Kalevala. His tailor father built the house around 1800. It is a modest, traditional southwestern Finnish house. Besides the main room, the cottage includes a hallway and a chamber, which were added later.

The yard, surrounded by a stone and brush fence, also has a wooden storehouse and two cellars on the slope leading to the lake. In the 1920s, a Jugend-style caretaker's house, cowshed, and barn were built near the cottage. The state acquired the cottage in 1889 and began renovating it into a museum. The buildings in the yard were restored, and original items were returned to the interiors. You can see Elias Lönnrot's black-stained kantele and furniture made by him, such as a writing desk and a bookcase.

name: Palanderin talo
description:
Palander House is a museum in Hämeenlinna that showcases the life of a bourgeois family in a town setting about a century ago. The house museum features fully furnished rooms, from the festive hall to the kitchen used by the servants.

The museum is located in a beautiful wooden house area in the northeastern corner of the city center. The house museum is named after the Palander family, who owned the building for a long time. E.W. Palander's family, who worked as a Russian language lecturer at Hämeenlinna Lyceum, lived in the house from 1884 to 1904. In addition to the permanent exhibition, the museum has two seasonal exhibitions each year: Palander House Christmas and Palander House Easter, which are also open on weekdays during the winter season, unlike other opening hours.

name: Palsa-museo
description:
Palsa-museo is the home and studio of the Kittilä-born artist Kalervo Palsa (1947-1987). The museum is located in Narikka, in the village of Kittilä.

Kalervo Palsa was known for his provocative, sexual, and often dark paintings. The house was uninhabited after the artist's death and had fallen into disrepair. The Kauko Sorjonen Foundation acquired the property in 2011, and it was restored in 2012. The Palsa Museum opened to the public on June 6, 2013. The studio displays wall paintings by the artist and is decorated with his belongings.

name: Paraisten kotiseutumuseo
description:
Paraisten kotiseutumuseo, or Pargas hembygdsmuseum, is an open-air museum located in Parainen. Founded in 1928, it showcases the history of the area through a collection of old buildings representing different social classes and their lives in past centuries.

The museum area features about ten buildings that illuminate the history of Parainen from different centuries. The interiors of the museum buildings tell about the life of the people of Parainen in the olden days. Among other things, there is an 18th-century sailor's croft and other historical buildings. It's described as a beautiful and peaceful oasis in the middle of the town, with a museum garden filled with old useful and ornamental plants, and plenty of space for children to play. Guided tours are available to learn about crofter life and old customs, as well as local ghost stories and folk beliefs.

name: Parkanon metsämuseo
description:
Parkanon metsämuseo (Parkano Forest Museum) showcases the history of forestry work from the rise of the sawmills in the 1860s to the mechanization of the 1960s.

The museum area includes an exhibition hall, a logging camp, a sauna, a horse stable, and forestry machinery. In addition, there is a nature trail, Messukallio, a beach, lean-to shelters, and campfire sites near the museum. The area is also part of the Lauhanvuori-Hämeenkangas Geopark. Visitors can explore the area and enjoy nature even outside of opening hours. In August 2007, an exhibition about forest conservation was opened at the museum.

name: Pateniemen sahan museo
description:
The Pateniemi Sawmill Museum is a museum dedicated to the sawmill industry, located in the Pateniemi district of Oulu. It's run by the Northern Ostrobothnia Museum and focuses on showcasing the operations and history of the Pateniemi sawmill, which operated from 1873 to 1990.

The museum is situated in a warehouse building that dates back to the 1850s, which originally belonged to a shipyard. It provides an authentic environment to explore the industrial history of the Oulu region. Almost all of Pateniemi's residents made their living from the sawmill. The museum is open during the summer, and admission is free.

name: Pelastusarmeijan museo
description:
The Salvation Army Museum in Helsinki presents the history of the Salvation Army in Finland for over 130 years. The museum's exhibition showcases the organization's history from both international and national perspectives, from its early difficulties to the present day.

Visitors can explore the story and activities of the Salvation Army in Finland through fascinating objects. The museum highlights the work done with children, the poor, and substance abusers throughout the years. It also sheds light on the lives of officers who have served abroad and the history of the Salvation Army's various forms of work. The museum is located at Uudenmaankatu 40.

name: Peltolan Mäkitupalaismuseo
description:
Peltolan Mäkitupalaismuseo is a nationally valuable cultural heritage site located in Tammijärvi, Luhanka. The buildings, interiors and artifacts tell about the lives of the "mäkitupalaiset" (cottagers) lived in the early 1900s. The area, situated between the southwest shore of Tammijärvi and the Luhanka-Joutsa road, is part of the Mäentalo area, also known as Peltola village.

The museum was established in 1962 on a site inhabited by cottagers and tenants. The oldest building, Isotupa, was originally built as a smokehouse in the 1700s. In the yard, the buildings are placed freely, reflecting the authentic lifestyle of the cottagers. The building stock, preserved in its original location, together with the surrounding traditional landscape, is considered a nationally significant cultural environment. The museum features 19 log buildings and about 3000 objects. During the summer season, visitors can explore the old-time farm and buildings.

name: Perttelin kotiseutumuseo
description: The Pertteli Local Heritage Museum is located in Pertteli, Salo. It's maintained by the Pertteli Local Heritage Association. The museum resides in a former granary made of stone, which was completed in 1863. The building material of the granary consists of foundation stones from the old Uskela mother church. On display, you can find wooden sculptures that were once in the Pertteli church, as well as a rich collection of artifacts gathered from Pertteli. The museum provides insights into the local history and culture of the area. The building itself, "Kivimakasiini", is located near Pertteli church in Kaivola.

name: Pielisen museo
description: Pielisen Museum is a cultural history museum located in Lieksa, North Karelia.
