Its outdoor area is open to the public during the summer season, while the indoor exhibitions of the main building are open during the winter. The construction of the open-air museum began in 1963, and it is the second largest open-air museum in Finland. The area has nearly 70 buildings and 95 sites from different eras, with the oldest buildings dating back to the 17th century. Additionally, there is a museum of objects and a logging museum. The buildings and objects reflect influences from both the East and the West. There is also a cafe during the summer.

name: Pohjois-Karjalan museo
description:
The North Karelian Museum, also known as Pohjois-Karjalan museo Hilma, is a museum dedicated to preserving and showcasing the cultural history of the North Karelia region in Finland. Founded in 1917, the museum was previously located in the Carelicum cultural center in Joensuu, but it closed its doors there in December 2023. The museum is currently planning new exhibitions and is scheduled to reopen in 2025 in a building designed by Eliel Saarinen, which previously housed the Joensuu city administration.

The museum's collections include artifacts, photographs, and other materials related to the region. Its permanent exhibition, "Journey in Karelia", presents the history and folk culture of North Karelia and parts of Ladoga Karelia. The museum also organizes temporary exhibitions, including photography exhibitions and exhibitions for children and families.

name: Pohjois-Pohjanmaan museo
description: The Northern Ostrobothnia Museum, founded in 1896, is a museum of cultural history located in Oulu, focusing on the history of Oulu and the surrounding Northern Ostrobothnia region. The museum is currently closed to the public and is expected to reopen in 2026 in new premises in the Myllytulli district. The museum's collections include youth culture, designers from Northern Ostrobothnia, the Tiernapoika tradition, and female photographers in the region. The museum also has a strong national presence as a recorder of tar traditions and the life's work of writer Samuli Paulaharju. Several specialized museums are connected to the Northern Ostrobothnia Museum, including the Turkansaari Open-air Museum and the Sailor's Home Museum, which are open during the summer.

name: Poliisimuseo
description:
The Poliisimuseo, or Police Museum, located in Tampere, is Finland's only police museum and a popular destination for families. It showcases the history of the Finnish police force from the Middle Ages to the present day.

The museum exhibits a diverse collection of police tools, equipment, and vehicles, allowing visitors to explore intriguing stories, notable Finnish crime cases, and related artifacts. Children can enjoy a special police-themed room called Pokela, where they can dress up in police uniforms and role-play. The museum also offers online exhibitions and virtual tours for those interested in learning more about the police force outside of regular hours. Admission to the museum is free.

name: Polyteekkarimuseo
description:
The Polyteekkarimuseo, founded in 1958, is a museum dedicated to the culture and traditions of technology students. It is maintained solely by voluntary student work, making it unique. Located in Otaniemi, the museum showcases the student world through pictures, artifacts, and stories spanning three centuries.

Exhibits include student caps and overalls, highlighting notorious events and pranks, alongside more serious historical aspects. The museum's collection is constantly updated. It is open to the public on Sundays during academic terms and at other times by request, with guided tours available. The museum provides insights into the history, traditions, and modern-day life of technology students.

name: Pommern
description:
Pommeri is a historical region on the southern coast of the Baltic Sea, between the Recknitz and Vistula rivers. It is divided between Germany and Poland. The western part is in Mecklenburg-Vorpommern, Germany, and the eastern part is in West Pomerania, Poland. The historical center of the region is Szczecin.

The name "Pommeri" comes from the Slavic "po morie," meaning "by the sea." Historically, it has been a border region between Poland and Germany. After World War II, Germany lost about half of Pommeri. The area was a popular vacation spot in East Germany. The Oder River delta has formed over centuries and was once home to Viking villages. Mariehamn also has a four-masted barque named "Pommern".

name: Porin taidemuseo
description:
The Pori Art Museum is a museum of contemporary art founded in 1981 around Professor Maire Gullichsen's collection. It is located in Pori, Finland, in a former warehouse building dating back to 1860. The museum showcases the latest trends in Finnish and international art.

The museum is known for its changing exhibitions. In addition to the exhibitions, the museum also serves as the regional museum for the Satakunta region. Poriginal Galleria is also located in connection with the Pori Art Museum. The museum building is located by the Kokemäenjoki River and was renovated to serve as a art museum by architect Kristian Gullichsen.

name: Porlammin kotiseutumuseo
description: The Porlammi Local Heritage Museum was established in 1943. The museum's collection is housed in four buildings in the warehouse area, three of which have open exhibition space. The warehouse area forms a coherent whole, shaped by the village's needs and connected to the village landscape. It includes an old warehouse, a village blacksmith's shop, and a garage from the 1930s that later served as a blacksmith's shop. The museum aims to protect local history and preserve related materials.

name: Porvoon museo
description:
Porvoon Museo is one of the oldest museums in Finland, founded in 1896. It's dedicated to preserving and showcasing the cultural and natural heritage of Porvoo and Eastern Uusimaa. The museum operates in two main buildings: the Old Town Hall, which features exhibits about the region's history from the Ice Age to the 18th century, and Holm House, a house museum displaying the life of a wealthy 18th-century merchant.

The museum's collections include historical objects, art, and natural history specimens. It also manages collections in the J. L. Runeberg's Home Museum and Walter Runeberg's Sculpture Collection. Porvoon Museo offers a rich insight into the history and culture of the area and hosts various exhibitions and events.

name: Posion kotiseutumuseo‎
description:
The Posio Local Heritage Museum is located in the village of Lohiranta, on the southern shore of Lake Kitkajärvi. The main building of the museum, called Lohi-Päätalo, was built in 1895 and is decorated in a traditional peasant style.

The museum's collection includes about a thousand local artifacts, the oldest of which date back to the 18th century. The museum grounds also include a stable-granary and a small storehouse that were moved to the site later. At its peak, over 30 people lived on the farm.

The museum is open during the summer, from late June to early August. During the summer, the Posio Local Heritage Museum hosts other events. The museum is accessible by car, and there is parking for caravans. However, access to the inside of the museum is not step-free.

name: Postimuseo
description:
The Postal Museum, founded in 1926, is a specialized museum that showcases the history of the Finnish postal system. It is located in Tampere, within the Vapriikki Museum Centre.

The museum's "Messengers" exhibition tells the long history of mail and communication from 1638 to the present day. In addition to a collection of postal-related objects, the museum has a stamp collection comprising all Finnish stamps, a picture archive, and a library open to the public. The Postal Museum also archives materials generated in the design and production of stamps: artwork, working drawings, proofs, color samples, and printing sheets.

name: Postimäki
description:
Postimäki is an open-air museum and a significant cultural heritage site located in Ilola, about 9 km northeast of Porvoo. It features one of Finland's best-preserved side-cottage areas. The oldest buildings date back to the 18th century.

In the 19th century, it became a residential area for cottagers and crofters, including tailors, blacksmiths, and shoemakers. Since the late 1960s, Postimäki has been known for its outdoor theater, music performances, crafts, and a charming coffee house. Today, it hosts guided tours, school visits, and public events. Many cottages are furnished to reflect their historical uses, including a straw museum, a shoemaker's workshop, and a smithy.

name: Pukkilan kartano
description:
Pukkilan kartano is a manor located in Salo, dating back to the 1700s. The manor's lands form one of Salo's villages. Pukkilan kartano sits on a hill surrounded by fields. Villiläntie road passes by the hill. The manor is still a working farm, and the old barn has been converted into a function space. The Karhujoki river flows south of Pukkila, near the manor.

The earliest mention of the Pukkila estate dates back to the 1500s. It belonged to the Munck af Fulkila family until 1681, when it was transferred to the Crown in a reduction. Pukkila was divided into the Maunu and Paukku cavalry estates, which were reunited in the 1700s to form Pukkilan kartano. Today, Pukkila is a diverse crop farm where sugar beet, cumin, oil plants and cereals are grown in the fields. Agriculture is still the main source of income.

name: Pukstaavi
description: Pukstaavi is the Museum of Finnish Book located in Sastamala. It is found within the historic Book Quarter. Pukstaavi aims to offer visitors of all ages knowledge and experiences related to books and reading. The museum has exhibitions, guided tours, lectures, courses, workshops, and events. The main exhibition showcases the history of the Finnish book from the earliest examples to e-books. The museum highlights the connection between books and the development of society. The museum works to make cultural heritage participatory and accessible to the local community.

name: Raatteen vartiomuseo
description: The Raate Frontier Guard Museum is located at the eastern end of Raate Road in Suomussalmi. It has been restored to its 1939 state and showcases the life of a frontier guard post before the Second World War. The museum also provides information about the Winter War events along Raate Road and their impact on the daily life of the guard post. It is the only guardhouse built before the war by the independent state of Finland that remains. The museum was founded in the summer of 1988. The building itself was built in 1923 and has served soldiers from Finland, Russia, and Germany.

name: Radio- ja tv-museo
description:
The Radio and TV Museum, also known as Mastola, is located in Lahti, Finland, on Radiomäki (Radio Hill). It's situated near the city center and is easily recognizable due to the two 150-meter-high radio masts built in 1927, which are a symbol of the city.

The museum itself is housed in a radio station building designed by Kaarlo Könönen in 1935. Opened in 1993 and renovated between 2014 and 2016, it operates under the Lahti City Museum. As a national specialist museum, it collects, researches, and exhibits items and traditions related to radio and television, particularly in Finland. Visitors can explore old radio and television programs and equipment from different eras, along with temporary exhibitions, seminars and events. The museum's collection includes radio and TV receivers, broadcasting technology, and audio recording equipment.

name: Ragvaldsin museoalue
description:
Ragvaldsin museoalue is a traditional farmstead located along the old King's Road in Kirkkonummi. The farm's history dates back to the 1540s. The last private owner was Bertil Malmström (1900-1982). After his death, the farm center was turned into a municipal museum.

The museum features the main building with its original furnishings, reflecting Bertil Malmström's life. There's also an exhibit about the Porkkala period (1944-1956) when the area was leased to the Soviet Union as a naval base. You can also explore the nature trail, the teaching garden showcasing old crop varieties, and peek into the barn to see paintings from the Porkkala period. The museum aims to preserve and strengthen the understanding of the region's culture, history, and environment.

name: Rakennusalan työvälinemuseo
description: The Rakennusalan työvälinemuseo (Construction Industry Tool Museum) was a specialized museum located in Kirkkonummi, near Hotel Nuuksio and Siikaranta-opisto. It showcased the evolution of construction work from the 1800s to the present day. The museum was housed in a two-story building. The first floor displayed the technical development of the field, starting from log construction. However, the museum is now closed, and its collections are part of the Työväenmuseo Werstas (The Finnish Labour Museum) collections.

name: Ranuan pappila- ja pitäjämuseo
description: The Ranua Parish Rectory and Local History Museum is located in the old rectory building, constructed in 1916. The lower floor showcases the interior of a rural rectory from the 1930s and 1940s, providing insight into the life of a vicar in a small rural parish. Upstairs, the local history museum presents Ranua's history, focusing on livelihoods through the seasons. The exhibition includes agricultural history, Stone Age artifacts, and traditional handicrafts from Ranua. The museum is owned and maintained by the municipality of Ranua and is open during the summer season. You can also take a virtual tour of the museum.

name: Ratikkamuseo
description:
The Ratikkamuseo, or Tram Museum, is located in Helsinki's Taka-Töölö district. It resides in the city's oldest tram hall, dating back to 1900, designed by architect Waldemar Aspelin. As part of the Helsinki City Museum, it showcases the history of Helsinki's tram traffic.

Inside, you can explore different tram models and related artifacts, including a horse-drawn tram from the late 1800s and an open-air car used during the 1952 Olympics. A highlight is the "Sisulaattori," a tram simulator that takes you on a journey through Helsinki's past, experiencing different eras through sound and visuals. The museum also features driver and conductor outfits from different decades and a farrier's workshop.

name: Rauman museo
description:
The Rauma Museum, established in 1891, showcases the city's history, especially that of Old Rauma, a UNESCO World Heritage site. The museum focuses on the area's cultural history, displaying artifacts and archival materials, some dating back to the Middle Ages. A particular specialty is Rauma lace-making, a living tradition.

The museum operates in several locations, including the Old Town Hall, Marela (a shipowner's home), Kirsti (a sailor's and craftsman's home), and the Potter's Workshop. The Old Town Hall, dating back to 1776, is currently under restoration, expected to be completed by 2026.

name: Rauman taidemuseo
description:
Rauma Art Museum is located in the Pinnala House in Old Rauma. The museum buildings and the idyllic courtyard form one of the best-preserved building groups in Old Rauma. The historical setting provides a perfect environment for showcasing various art phenomena, from modern art to art history.

The museum is responsible for preserving and presenting art from Rauma and its surrounding areas. Another focus is contemporary art from the Baltic Sea region and the Baltic countries. This stems from the Rauma Biennale Balticum exhibition series, which has been organized at the Rauma Art Museum for a long time. Currently, the exhibition is held every three years under the name Rauma Triennale. The museum's calendar includes temporary exhibitions, events, and workshops.

name: Rautalammin museo
description:
The Rautalammi Museum is a cultural history museum established in 1938. It is located in the main village of Rautalammi. The museum's collections include over 70,000 items, including objects, photographs, art, and a local history archive.

The main exhibition, titled "Along the Rautalampi Route," showcases the history of the Rautalampi region from prehistoric times to World War II and the Helsinki Olympics. The outdoor museum area features a smoke sauna, outbuildings, a windmill, and North Savo's only museum church boat, the Kuikka, from the late 1800s. You can explore the history of Rautalampi and the museum's art collection through culture and art trails. The museum shop offers local handicrafts, books, postcards and local honey.

name: Retretti
description:
Retretti was a unique art center located in Punkaharju. It was known for its extensive underground exhibition spaces carved into the bedrock. These man-made caves extended deep below the surface, offering a distinctive environment for displaying art.

The art center hosted various visual art and applied art exhibitions, as well as concerts. After Retretti Oy faced bankruptcy in 2012, the exhibition activities were discontinued. While a new company operates under the name Retretti in Savonlinna, reopening the original underground exhibition spaces wasn't initially a priority. However, there have been recent discussions about revitalizing the original site, but no final decisions have been made.

name: Riihimäen taidemuseo
description:
The Riihimäki Art Museum was founded in 1994, thanks to a donation made to the city of Riihimäki in 1993 by art and antiques dealer Pentti Wähärjärvi. The museum houses a collection of over 2,000 artworks and objects, primarily focusing on early 20th-century Finnish art. The collection features works by artists who belonged to the November and Septem groups. Key figures in the collection include Helene Schjerfbeck, Ellen Thesleff, Tyko Sallinen, and Eero Nelimarkka.

The Riihimäki Art Museum is located in a former state office building designed by Marjatta and Martti Jaatinen, completed in 1963. The building was renovated to meet the requirements of a modern art museum and opened to the public in 1995. The museum hosts changing exhibitions of Finnish and foreign art from various fields of visual arts and culture, solo exhibitions by renowned artists, and various themed exhibitions. The art museum also organizes various side events, workshops and lectures for museum guests of all ages. Additionally, visitors are served by a charming museum shop.

name: Rikosmuseo
description:
The Rikosmuseo (Crime Museum) is located in Vantaa, within the premises of the National Bureau of Investigation (KRP). Established in 1937, it showcases materials related to crime investigation and Finnish crime history.

The museum is not open to the general public due to security reasons, as it is situated within the headquarters of the KRP, where confidential information is handled. Visits are only possible for police staff and related stakeholders by special arrangement. However, some of the museum's artifacts are displayed at the Police Museum in Tampere, which is open to the public. The Crime Museum's collections are now part of the Police Museum.

name: Riuttalan talonpoikaismuseo
description:
Riuttalan Talonpoikaismuseo is a museum located in the village of Riuttala, in the Karttula region of Kuopio. The museum presents the traditions and rural life of Northern Savonia from the turn of the 19th and 20th centuries.

The history of Riuttala farm dates back to 1657. The farm was chosen to represent Finnish rural life at the Paris World Exhibition in 1900. The museum area covers 14 hectares and includes over 20 farm buildings, such as the main building, a smithy, a windmill, and a large threshing barn. A unique aspect of the museum is the number of buildings and the fact that most of the items on display are original artifacts that were once used on the farm.

name: Rosenlew-museo
description: The Rosenlew Museum is located in Pori, in the Aittaluoto district, near the traditional factory area. It showcases and preserves Satakunta's industrial cultural heritage, focusing on the history and production of the Rosenlew company from the 1850s to 1980s. The museum is housed in a protected grain warehouse building and features exhibits about the company's diverse operations, including woodworking, metalworking, packaging, and power generation. You can explore Finnish design, such as Porin Matti ovens and cast iron pots. The museum also hosts temporary exhibitions, events, and lectures. Guided tours are available.

name: Rovaniemen kotiseutumuseo
description:
The Rovaniemi Local History Museum showcases life in a prosperous house in the Peräpohjola region at the turn of the 19th and 20th centuries. The museum is located in Rovaniemi, in the Pöykkölä farmyard by the Kemijoki River. The main building of the museum, a Peräpohjola-style log building from the 1840s, is one of the few Kemijoki River valley houses that survived the destruction of the Lapland War.

Other original buildings that belonged to the Pöykkölä farm include a handsome barn and two granaries. The other buildings in the museum have been moved to the museum area from different parts of Rovaniemi. The museum's collections consist of peasant artifacts from the turn of the 19th and 20th centuries, mainly related to livelihoods such as fishing, agriculture, forestry, and reindeer husbandry.

name: Rovaniemen taidemuseo
description:
The Rovaniemi Art Museum, established in 1986, serves as the regional art museum for the Lapland region, excluding Tornionlaakso and Meri-Lappi. It is situated in the Korundi Culture House in central Rovaniemi. The museum's collection originated from a donation by the Jenny and Antti Wihuri Foundation and now includes over 3,500 works, mainly Finnish contemporary art.

Housed in a former postal depot renovated in the 1980s, the museum shares the building with the Lapland Chamber Orchestra. The building also houses the Korundi Kitchen & Café and the Korundi Shop.

name: Ränkimäen talomuseo
description:
Ränkimäki Homestead Museum is a local museum in Lapua, where collections for a museum started in the 1930s. The actual museum area was assembled and built after the wars, mainly in the first half of the 1950s. Ränkimäki was chosen as the location of the museum, on the site of a Russian artillery station during the Finnish War.

More than a dozen buildings have been moved to the Ränkimäki yard from different parts of Lapua. The place was built as an open-air museum, and no one has actually lived in the museum yard. The oldest building is a smithy dating back to the 1700s, originally a smoke sauna. The main building, completed in 1875, is decorated to look as it did over 100 years ago.

name: S/S Santtu
description: S/S Santtu is a museum tugboat located in Reposaari, Pori. This iron-hulled steamship was built in 1894 at the Helsinki shipyard. Its previous names were Bomba and Santahamina. Initially, S/S Bomba served as a transport ship for the Russian coastal artillery in the Gulf of Finland. In 1918, it was seized by the Finnish government and transferred to the Finnish Navy, renamed S/S Santahamina, and used as a transport ship between Helsinki and nearby naval stations. Later, it was acquired by Werner Hacklin Ltd in 1938 and renamed S/S Santtu. Today, the ship belongs to the collections of the Satakunta Museum.

name: Saamelaismuseo Siida
description:
Siida is the Sámi Museum and Northern Lapland Nature Centre, located in the village of Inari. It serves as a national museum with a special responsibility for Sámi culture, as well as a regional museum for cultural environment tasks in the Sámi homeland. The museum collects and presents the intangible and tangible culture of the Finnish Sámi through exhibitions and publications.

Siida aims to support Sámi identity and cultural self-esteem. It has sister museums in other Nordic countries and Russia, and belongs to the network of indigenous museums worldwide. The exhibitions at Siida explore the layers of the landscape through the Sámi concept of cultural environment, emphasizing the close connection between nature and culture. In 2024, Siida broke visitor records with over 82,000 visitors.

name: Saarijärven museo
description:
The Saarijärvi Museum is a local museum for art and cultural history, situated by Lake Herajärvi. It functions as an information center for its region, archiving objects, photographs, archival material, and art that tell the story of the area's development. The museum organizes art and cultural-historical exhibitions throughout the year.

The museum also maintains the Stone Age Village and is responsible for the exhibition activities and material collections of Tapperien Juhola. Saarijärvi's art collection is exhibited in the Sculpture Park in the museum's yard and in the town hall lobby, showcasing local sculptors and artworks. The museum aims to increase appreciation and understanding of cultural heritage, enhance art awareness, and provide memorable experiences.

name: Saarion voimalaitosmuseo
description:
The Saarion voimalaitosmuseo (Saario Power Plant Museum) is located in the village of Saario, on the banks of the Jänisjoki River. Originally built in 1908 by Wärtsilä-Aktiebolag, the power plant supplied electricity to the Wärtsilä ironworks. The museum showcases the history of the power plant and its role in the local community.

The architecture features Central European neo-Gothic influences, evident in its elevated gable facades and brickwork. Inside, the machine hall contains original elements like large generators, turbine adjusters, and marble control panels. The power plant operated until 1984, when a new remote-controlled power plant was built. Thanks to the local village association, the old power plant was preserved and transformed into a museum in 1991, offering visitors a glimpse into the past. You can even take a virtual tour of the museum online.

name: Sagalundin museo
description:
Sagalund Museum is a living local history museum, children's culture center, and garden located near the center of Kemiönsaari. It focuses on cultural heritage and environmental education, implemented in diverse and child-centered ways. Founded in 1910, it's Finland's first open-air museum.

Over twenty buildings have been relocated to the area from various parts of Kemiönsaari, including a courthouse, a croft, a farm, a villa, and two schools. There are also inspiring play environments for children. The museum area is open in the summer, and the main building, Sagalundgården, with its lunch café and museum shop, is open year-round. The garden is inspired by Carl von Linné, featuring plants and a rose garden. The museum also has educational activities for children, like the cultivation school, where they learn about planting and harvesting.

name: Sakkola-museo
description:
Sakkola Museum is located in Lempäälä, on the Kuokkala Museum Trail. It was opened to the public in the summer of 2000. The museum showcases the cultural history of the former municipality of Sakkola, which was located on the Karelian Isthmus. The Sakkola Foundation is responsible for the museum's operations. The museum's collection consists of donated items, most of which were brought from Sakkola during the evacuation.

The museum has a permanent exhibition and an annually changing theme exhibition. You can also buy Sakkola-themed literature and souvenirs. The museum features everyday objects from Sakkola homes like irons, potato peelers and coffee grinders.

name: Sallan sota- ja jälleenrakennusajan museo
description:
The Salla War and Reconstruction Museum is located near the center of Salla, in the old railway workers' residences at the former railway station area. Besides exhibition spaces, the museum building houses a museum shop and cafe. The museum area also features an outdoor exhibition space and the Salla Rajakievari tavern, which hosts temporary exhibitions and cultural events.

The main exhibition portrays the history of Kuolajärvi (Salla's former name) from the early 1900s before the wars, the turbulent war years, and the massive reconstruction efforts that followed, during which the war-torn Salla municipality strived for a new beginning. The museum is open year-round to tourists and locals.

name: Salon taidemuseo Veturitalli
description:
Salon Art Museum Veturitalli is located in a repurposed, over 100-year-old former locomotive depot near the Salo train station. It showcases diverse and high-quality local and international art.

The museum's collections consist of approximately 2450 works. Veturitalli opened as an art museum in October 1998, after extensive renovations transformed the old brick building into a modern art space. The exhibition program includes rotating exhibitions in the main halls and smaller exhibitions in Galleria Sivuraide. In addition to exhibitions, Veturitalli hosts various events and concerts. The building is partially accessible and has accessible parking and restrooms.

name: Sara Hildénin taidemuseo
description:
Sara Hildén Art Museum is located in Tampere, Finland, specifically in the Särkänniemi district, overlooking Lake Näsijärvi. The museum specializes in international modernism and contemporary art. It is maintained by the City of Tampere and is the permanent home of the Sara Hildén Foundation's art collection, which was founded in 1962.

The museum building was designed by Pekka Ilveskoski Architects. In addition to the museum building, there is also an open-air gallery that features sculptures. The Sara Hildén Foundation's collection comprises over 5,000 works of art. The museum is known for its high-quality art collection, internationally significant exhibitions and publications.

name: Satakunnan Museo
description:
The Satakunta Museum is a historical museum located in Pori, Finland. Established in 1888, it is one of the oldest museums of its kind in Finland. In 1980, it gained the status of a Regional Museum.

The museum's main focus is presenting the history of the Satakunta province and the city of Pori. Its collections contain over 80,000 artifacts and objects. The archives hold over 300,000 photographs, maps, and architectural drawings.

Located near the city center by the Kokemäenjoki river, the current museum building was completed in 1973. Besides exhibitions, the museum also functions as a tourist information point for the city of Pori.

name: Satakunnan museo
description:
Satakunnan Museo is a cultural history museum located in Pori, near the Kokemäki River. It's one of Finland's oldest museums, founded in 1888, focusing on the history of the Satakunta region from prehistoric times to the present day.

The museum's exhibitions showcase local life, phenomena, and historical events. Visitors can explore different eras through displays of homes and costumes and view a large model of Pori. The museum also features temporary exhibitions and events.

Satakunnan Museo is part of the Pori Museums, along with the Ark Nature Centre, Rosenlew Museum, and the House of Building Culture Toivo. The museum is open from Tuesday to Sunday, offering a glimpse into the past and present of the Satakunta region.

name: Saukkojärven kotiseutu- ja koulumuseo
description:
Saukkojärven kotiseutu- ja koulumuseo is located in the village of Saukkojärvi in Ranua, Lapland. It is situated approximately 20 kilometers north of the Ranua church village. This museum showcases a rural primary school from the 1930s and 1940s. The school building itself is the oldest in Ranua, dating back to the end of the 19th century.

The downstairs area features a classroom museum furnished in the style of the 1930s to 1950s, complete with original furniture used by the school and its teachers. Upstairs, the local history museum exhibits artifacts from 20th-century peasant life. The museum complex includes the old primary school's main building from 1898, a dormitory, a woodshed, and a sauna by the lake. The building served as a school until December 1958. The museum is open during the summer season, specifically in July.

name: Savilahden kivisakasti
description:
Savilahden kivisakasti, located in Mikkeli, is the stone sacristy of the old Savilahti parish church. It stands in the middle of Porrassalmenkatu street. The sacristy is the oldest building in the region of Etelä-Savo, possibly built in the first half of the 16th century. Initially intended as the first step for a stone church, the plans were abandoned.

The church fell into disrepair in the 18th century and was eventually replaced. The stone sacristy remained, though slated for demolition multiple times. It received its current appearance with a high shingle roof, roof turret, and decorative brick gables during renovations at the turn of the 20th century. The sacristy features a sacrament cupboard on the north wall and a window on the east wall.

name: Savon radan museo
description:
The Savon Railway Museum is located in Pieksämäki, within the old station building that was completed in 1889. The museum's renovated exhibition comprehensively presents railway history, with a particular emphasis on the Savon railway line and the Pieksämäki region.

On display, you can find railway construction tools, parts of steam locomotives, traffic control, communication, and signaling equipment, station interiors, a model railway, and railway workshop tools. The museum also offers the possibility to watch railway-themed videos and has a playground for children. The museum building is surrounded by a station park, which exhibits a diesel-powered shunting locomotive Vk12 from 1937. The museum is maintained by the city of Pieksämäki.

name: Savonlinnan maakuntamuseo
description:
The Savonlinna Provincial Museum, now known as Riihisaari – Savonlinna Museum, focuses on the cultural history of Southern Savonia and the sailing history of Lake Saimaa. Located in a former state granary designed by Ernst B. Lohrmann and completed in 1852, it sits near Olavinlinna castle.

The museum's exhibits showcase life on Lake Saimaa's shores, including prehistoric times, 18th-century church art, a Savo cottage from the 1920s, and ship models. Notably, it features Finland's oldest Savo-style boat. In the summertime, visitors can admire unique steamships, including the steam schooner Salama and the tar steamer Mikko. The museum preserves and presents the history of sailing on Lake Saimaa, highlighting the region's cultural and natural heritage.

name: Savonlinnan museo
description:
The Savonlinna Museum is located in the center of Savonlinna, in Riihisaari, next to Olavinlinna. The museum operates in a former state granary. The brick-built warehouse, designed by Ernst Bernhard Lohrmann, was completed in 1852, and the building and island were the first sites in Finland to be protected by the Building Protection Act in 1965.

The Savonlinna Museum focuses on the cultural history of South Savo and especially the sailing history of Lake Saimaa. The museum, which started operating in 1983, is owned and managed by the city of Savonlinna. The museum's collections are based on the collection donated by the Guild of St. Olaf and the material collected by the Saimaa Sailing Museum Association. The museum has several steamships and also organizes various exhibitions.

name: Serlachius-museo Gustaf
description:
Serlachius Museum Gustaf is located in Mänttä-Vilppula and is more than just a museum; it's a story house that narrates the tale of the Serlachius family. Gustaf Adolf Serlachius, an apothecary by training, founded a wood grinding mill in Mänttä in 1868, which laid the foundation for a significant industrial enterprise.

The museum showcases the history of the Finnish paper industry and art. The main exhibition, "Paper Devil", dramatically presents the life of paper industry pioneer G. A. Serlachius. The building itself, completed in 1934, represents classicism and functionalism, and served as the company's headquarters. Visitors can also explore the original head office and an apothecary's trade room offering hands-on activities for children. It hosts lectures, seminars, concerts and theatre performances.

name: Serlachius-museo Gösta
description: The Serlachius Museum Gösta is an art museum in Mänttä. It showcases a wide range of art, including Finnish art from the Golden Age, old European masters, and contemporary art. The museum is located in Joenniemi Manor, which was built as a home for Gösta Serlachius in 1935. In 2014, a large wooden extension called the Gösta Pavilion was opened. The new and old museum buildings together create a unique environment with a garden that opens towards the shore. The architecture of the pavilion has received international awards.

name: Seurasaaren ulkomuseo
description:
Seurasaari Open-Air Museum, founded in 1909, is located on Seurasaari Island in Helsinki. It offers visitors of all ages a glimpse into Finnish rural life from the 17th to the 20th centuries. The museum features 87 authentic buildings relocated from various regions of Finland, showcasing traditional Finnish architecture and lifestyles.

Often referred to as "rural Finland in miniature," Seurasaari provides a tranquil escape from the city. Visitors can explore smoke cabins, crofts, and manors, and even participate in guided tours. The island is also a popular spot for enjoying nature, with beaches and opportunities for picnics. The museum also has a café and shop where guests can find unique Finnish souvenirs. It is open from mid-May to mid-September.

name: Sibbesgården
description: Sibbesgården is a local history museum in Sipoo, located in Gesterby, one of the oldest villages in Sipoo. Several old buildings are located in the museum area, showcasing life in Sipoo long ago. The museum aims to maintain and strengthen the public's understanding of culture, history, and the environment. The local Sibbo association maintains the local history collection and offers parties and exhibitions for residents during the summer. Guided tours in the village and the museum are available where you can explore one of the oldest villages in Finland.

name: Sibeliuksen syntymäkoti
description:
The Sibelius Birth House is a museum located in Hämeenlinna, Finland. It is the birthplace of the famous Finnish composer Jean Sibelius, who was born there in 1865 and spent his first 20 years in the house. The house itself was built in 1834.

The museum showcases Sibelius's childhood and youth. The rooms are decorated in the style of the 1860s-1880s, with furniture, documents, photographs, and small items that tell the story of Sibelius's early life and Hämeenlinna during that era. The museum has been open since 1965. Currently, it is undergoing renovations in spring 2025 and will reopen in the summer, with a renewed exhibition focusing on Sibelius's childhood, relationship with nature and his connection to Hämeenlinna.

name: Sibelius-museo
description:
The Sibelius Museum is Finland's largest and most diverse music museum, showcasing the entire spectrum of Finnish musical life. The museum is dedicated to the life and work of Jean Sibelius, Finland's most famous composer.

The museum displays a collection of traditional and art music instruments from around the world. It houses over 2,000 instruments. The museum building itself is a notable example of 1960s modernism, designed by Woldemar Baeckman.

The Sibelius Museum hosts Wednesday concerts with chamber music during the spring and autumn seasons. The extensive archive includes a Jean Sibelius collection and other music-related materials, such as sheet music, photographs, and recordings.

name: Sigyn
description:
In Norse mythology, Sigyn is known as the loyal wife of Loki. Her name is said to mean "victory bringer" or "friend of victory". She is primarily known for her unwavering devotion to her husband, even after he is punished by the other gods.

After Loki is bound to a rock for his crimes, with a venomous serpent placed above him, dripping poison onto his face, Sigyn stays by his side. She holds a bowl to catch the venom, offering him what comfort she can. When the bowl is full, she has to leave to empty it, and during those moments the poison falls on Loki, causing him great pain and the earth to tremble. She is the mother of Narfi with Loki and is seen as a symbol of marital fidelity and constancy.

name: Sikurimuseo
description:
The Sikurimuseo, located in Jakobstad, is unique as Finland's only preserved chicory factory. It provides insights into the history of chicory cultivation.

The museum complex includes the factory building, the chicory master's house, a summer office, and a storehouse. The factory itself features the original chicory drying oven from 1893. In addition to the museum, visitors can explore chicory fields where the plant is grown and blooms in July.

Those interested can also sample chicory coffee and dishes, and purchase chicory products like coffee, honey, bread and soaps.

name: Sinebrychoffin taidemuseo
description:
The Sinebrychoff Art Museum is located on Bulevardi in Helsinki. It is Finland's only museum dedicated to old European art. The museum is housed in the former home of the Sinebrychoff brewing family and displays their collection of art and furniture.

The core of the museum is the home museum of Paul and Fanny Sinebrychoff, which showcases the atmosphere of a luxurious bourgeois home from the early 1900s. The art collections include Swedish portrait art, Dutch and Flemish art from the 17th century, and Italian and French paintings. It also holds the largest miniature collection in Finland and the only painting by Rembrandt in Finland.

name: Sipoon koulumuseo
description:
The Sipoo School Museum was founded in 1994 in the vacant Massby national school in Sipoo. In 2014, the museum was moved to the Mårtensby school, which had ceased operations. The Sipoo Adult Education Center also operates in the same building. It was opened in January 2015.

The building's long history reflects Sipoo's school culture and its development. The museum has one classroom decorated as an old-time classroom, and there is a lot of material from different decades in the school's entrance hall. Students can experience an old-fashioned school day by dressing up in aprons or vests, sitting at desks, and trying writing with ink. The museum is located at Martinkyläntie 485, 04240 Sipoo.

name: Sipoon maatalousmuseo
description: The Sipoo Agricultural Museum is a local museum in Nikkilä, Sipoo, focusing on the history of agriculture. It is located next to the new church of Nikkilä, in a former granary. The museum displays old tools and vehicles. Sibbo Hembygdsförening rf takes care of the museum. You can find the opening hours and contact information on the Sibbo Hembygdsföreningen website. It is open by appointment.

name: Sodankylän kotiseutumuseo
description:
The Sodankylä Local History Museum is a captivating destination situated in a beautiful riverside setting. A crown jewel of the museum area is the main building, which was rescued from the village of Riesto before the creation of the Loka reservoir.

The museum provides a glimpse into the past, showcasing the peasant life of the early 20th century in the Sodankylä and Sompio regions. Around the main building, there is a traditional courtyard with about 13 buildings. These include a warehouse, a smoke sauna, barns and granaries. The museum also features structures related to traditional livelihoods in Sodankylä, such as a smithy and a Lapland house. Inside the buildings, visitors can explore a rich collection of old Lappish artifacts.

name: Sotamuseo
description:
The Military Museum of Finland, or Sotamuseo, is the central museum of the Finnish Defence Forces and the national special museum of military history. Located in Helsinki, it operates as part of the Finnish National Defence University.

The museum collects, preserves, researches, and exhibits items and other heritage related to Finland's defense forces, military history, and the history of weaponry. Its exhibitions cover the wars fought during Finland's independence, from the Civil War of 1918 to the Winter, Continuation, and Lapland Wars of 1939-1945. Visitors can explore Finnish, Soviet, and German uniforms, weapons, and equipment from these periods. The museum's collection includes over 200,000 items, including weaponry, uniforms, art, and vehicles.

name: Stundarsin museo ja kulttuurikeskus
description:
Stundars is one of Finland's largest open-air museums, a living museum, and a handicrafts village. The buildings with their interiors depict rural life from the late 1800s to the early 1900s, showcasing the perspectives of farmers, artisans, and the landless population.

Founded in the 1930s, it features about sixty buildings relocated from villages in Korsholm and the Vaasa area. The museum buildings and artifacts demonstrate how people lived in Ostrobothnian villages during that era. Different social classes are represented, including a farmer's house, a village shop, a school, windmills, and various workshops.

Stundars keeps old handicraft skills alive through events like craft days and markets. The Hemmer House hosts art and music activities year-round and includes a memorial room for the writer Jarl Hemmer. In the summer, farm animals are brought to Stundars, and there are areas where children can try old-time chores.

name: Sukellusvene Vesikko
description:
The Sukellusvene Vesikko is a Finnish submarine that participated in the Winter and Continuation Wars. Built in 1933 in Turku, it was initially ordered by Germany but acquired by Finland in 1936. During the wars, it operated in the Gulf of Finland, performing escort and patrol duties. The Vesikko is the only Finnish submarine that was not scrapped after the war.

Today, the Vesikko is a museum ship located in Suomenlinna, Helsinki. Visitors can explore the submarine's interior and experience the cramped conditions in which the crew of 20 worked. It's a popular attraction, offering a glimpse into naval warfare history and submarine technology of the 1930s and 1940s.

name: Suomen Joutsen
description:
Suomen Joutsen, or the Swan of Finland, is a three-masted steel-hulled ship built in 1902 in France. Initially named Laënnec, it served as a cargo ship, transporting goods between Europe, North and South America, and Australia. In 1930, the Finnish government acquired it to serve as a training vessel for the Finnish Navy. Before World War II, it completed eight long ocean voyages, training over 650 students and promoting Finland's global recognition.

During the war, it functioned as a support ship for submarines and motor torpedo boats, later becoming a base for minesweepers. Since 1960, it has been permanently docked in Turku, on the Aura River. From 1960 to 1988, it operated as a maritime school, educating approximately 3700 students. Today, managed by the Forum Marinum Foundation, the Suomen Joutsen serves as a museum ship, open to the public and available for various events.

name: Suomen Rautatiemuseo
description:
The Finnish Railway Museum, located in Hyvinkää, is a national museum dedicated to railway heritage. It showcases the history of Finnish railways from the 1860s to the present day. The museum is situated in the historically significant former station and depot area of the Hanko-Hyvinkää railway.

The museum's exhibitions are housed in several buildings, including exhibition halls, an engine shed, a station, and barracks. The exhibits feature locomotives and rolling stock from different eras. One of the highlights is the oldest surviving steam locomotive from 1868. The museum also houses the only surviving Imperial coaches of the Russian Emperors, along with other interesting items related to Finnish railway history.

name: Suomen asutusmuseo
description:
The Finnish Settlement Museum (Suomen Asutusmuseo) is located in Alapitkä, Lapinlahti. It preserves the memory of people who lived on settlement farms and showcases farm life before the information age.

The museum complex includes a front-soldier house preserved in its original condition on the Alaranta farm in Alapitkä, a cowshed, a sauna, and a threshing barn, which serves as a café in the summer. All the items in the museum are original, belonging to the Mure family who lived on the farm. It is the only museum in Finland dedicated to the post-war settlement period. Visiting the museum is like a journey back to the everyday life history from the 1940s to the early 1970s.

name: Suomen hevosurheilumuseo
description:
The Finnish Horse Racing Museum is located in Ypäjä, next to the Hevosopisto office.
The museum building is a charming granary from the Kartanonkylä manor, dating back to the late 1700s.
The traditional Siittolanmäki area has been a stable area since the 1930s, and the cultural landscape of the Loimijoki River Valley surrounding the museum with its horse pastures is an idyllic sight.
The Horse Racing Museum's exhibition takes you on a journey into the world of riding and harness racing competitions of the past century.
The museum's mission is to record, archive, research, and publish Finnish horse racing history to the general public.

name: Suomen ilmailumuseo
description:
The Finnish Aviation Museum, located in Vantaa near the Helsinki-Vantaa Airport, focuses on Finnish aviation history and aircraft designed or used by Finns. As a national specialized museum, it showcases civil, military, and hobby aviation, featuring stars like the Convair Metropolitan passenger plane which visitors can explore inside.

The museum's collections include thousands of objects, along with extensive archives and photographic material. The museum also maintains the most extensive aviation library in Finland. Guided tours enhance the experience, and flight simulator experiences are available by reservation. The museum hosts various events throughout the year and also serves as a unique venue for celebrations and meetings.

name: Suomen jalkapallomuseo
description: The Football Museum of Finland is located in Valkeakoski, on the third floor of the Myllysaari Museum. It showcases the history of Finnish football with an extensive collection of awards, memorabilia, medals, photos, playing jerseys and football equipment from different decades. The museum also features material related to internationally recognized Finnish players. A significant part of the museum is the Hall of Fame of Finnish football, established in 1993. The museum has four sections, including two exhibition halls, an auditorium, and a meeting room.

name: Suomen jäähdytystekniikan museo
description:
The Finnish Museum of Refrigeration Technology, Suomen Jäähdytystekniikan Museo, is located in Ylöjärvi. It was founded in 1986 to showcase the history of refrigeration technology in Finland. The museum displays the evolution of cooling methods from natural ice to modern refrigeration.

Founded by Paavo V. Suominen, the museum houses over 300 items related to the development of refrigeration technology, including unique pieces. It features exhibits from the early days of mechanical refrigeration and inventions related to cooling with natural ice. One notable exhibit is the world's first hermetic refrigeration unit, used in Hotel Torni from 1905 to 1952. The museum also has a salt ice cabinet that once belonged to the parents of President Risto Ryti.

name: Suomen jääkiekkomuseo
description:
The Finnish Ice Hockey Museum is located in Tampere, specifically within the Vapriikki Museum Centre. It is one of only six ice hockey museums in the world. The museum showcases the history of Finnish ice hockey, from its humble beginnings in the 1930s to its current successes.

Exhibits include historical equipment, memorabilia, and trophies, including the original Canada Cup and the World Championship trophies won by the Finnish national team in 1995. The museum also maintains a Hall of Fame, honoring distinguished players, coaches, referees, and other influential figures in Finnish ice hockey. Visitors can also test their hockey skills with simulators.

name: Suomen kantelemuseo
description:
The Finnish Kantele Museum is located in Jyväskylä, specifically in the Palokan Pelimannitalo. It was founded in 2009 and showcases instruments and information from across the kantele's area of distribution, with a special focus on the kantele traditions of Central Finland. The museum was founded by Kari Dahlblom, an instrument researcher.

Initially, the museum had a collection of 40 kanteles, but by 2021, it had grown to around 160 instruments. Among the rarities in the museum's collection are the kantele of master musician Arvi Pokela, built by Juho Tamminen from Saarijärvi, a double kantele built by Tuure Peltonen from Uurainen, and a kantele by Pasi Jääskeläinen from Haapavesi. The museum is a treasure trove of Finnish kantele heritage and a fascinating place to learn about the history of this national instrument.

name: Suomen kellomuseo
description:
The Finnish Clock and Jewellery Museum Kruunu is located in Tapiola, Espoo. It is the only museum in the Nordic countries specializing in clocks and jewellery. The museum explores clock and jewelry culture, revealing its meanings through changing exhibitions, guided tours, workshops, and events. Kruunu takes visitors on a fascinating journey through the world of clocks and jewellery, telling stories from centuries ago to the present day.

The museum teaches about the work of clock and jewellery makers and showcases diverse collections. Kruunu is a place for gatherings and celebrations. It is easily accessible and located next to the P-Kulttuuriparkki parking garage.

name: Suomen koulumuseo
description:
The Finnish School Museum was located in Tampere, in the Tammela district, from the 1960s to the 1980s. It showcased the development of Finnish schools using models, interiors built into the space, and doll figures. The museum was situated in the old part of Tammela School.

The museum's collection is currently held by the Vapriikki Museum Centre. It forms its own separate collection of educational history, which is no longer being added to. It is stored in the Tampere Museums' collection center in the Rusko industrial area.

name: Suomen käsityön museo
description:
The Finnish Craft Museum, located in the heart of Jyväskylä, is a national museum dedicated to Finnish crafts and applied art. It showcases the history of Finnish crafts as part of the nation's cultural heritage. The museum features several changing exhibitions displaying various craft techniques and artistry.

The museum also houses the Finnish National Costume Center and a Conservation Center. The Finnish National Costume Center focuses on preserving and promoting Finnish national costumes. The museum offers activities and exhibitions suitable for all ages.

name: Suomen lasimuseo
description:
The Finnish Glass Museum, located in Riihimäki, is a national special museum dedicated to the history of glassmaking, the glass industry, and glass art. It showcases over 4000 years of glass history and 300 years of Finnish glassmaking tradition.

The museum is housed in a former factory building that once belonged to the Riihimäki glassworks, originally a peat powder factory in 1914. The building later served as a glass factory, plastic factory, silk screen, and finally, a crystal grinding shop for Riihimäki glass. The museum has around 1700 square meters of exhibition space and displays both Finnish and international glass art, industrial glass, and design.

name: Suomen maatalousmuseo Sarka
description:
The Finnish Agriculture Museum Sarka is the national museum of agriculture, located in Loimaa, Southwest Finland. It showcases the history and present day of Finnish agriculture and rural life through three permanent exhibitions and changing displays.

Located in the countryside, Sarka features both indoor and outdoor exhibits, including a machine exhibition displaying the evolution of agricultural machinery. During the summer, the museum grounds have animals and tracks for pedal tractors and hobbyhorses. Traditional hay barns and a threshing barn from different parts of Finland border the yard area.

Sarka also has a lunch restaurant-cafe and a museum shop. They also rent out functional spaces for events. The museum conveys tradition and knowledge, provides experiences and opens perspectives to the future.

name: Suomen nyrkkeilymuseo
description:
The Finnish Boxing Museum, Suomen Nyrkkeilymuseo, is located in Tampere. It's a unique museum dedicated to the history of boxing in Finland. Founded in 1991, its purpose is to gather, preserve, and exhibit boxing-related equipment, medals, photographs, and other materials.

The museum's collection consists of approximately 20,000 items, including donations and loans from private individuals and organizations. The oldest items are boxing-themed stamps from the 1896 Athens Olympics. A large exhibit is a bronze statue depicting Pentti Hämäläinen, a Finnish Olympic boxing champion. The collection also includes boxing gloves, trophies, medals, commemorative pins, books, magazines, photos and posters related to boxing.

name: Suomen partiomuseo
description:
The Finnish Scouting Museum is a national special museum located in Turku. It is dedicated to showcasing the history and activities of the Finnish scouting movement. The museum's collections include various scouting-related items, such as objects, photographs, flags, banners, clothing, books, and archival materials, spanning the entire history of scouting in Finland.

The museum is run by the Finnish Scouting Museum Association and operates entirely with volunteers. It collects, preserves, and exhibits items and documents that illuminate the past and present of the scouting movement. The museum aims to generate interest in the activities and history of scouting by presenting it to the public. The museum is open on Mondays from 9 AM to 12 PM and Saturdays from 12 PM to 3 PM.

name: Suomen pelimuseo
description:
The Finnish Museum of Games, located in Tampere, is dedicated to the history of Finnish game culture and the evolution of the gaming industry. It showcases a diverse collection of one hundred Finnish games, from early board games to digital creations.

Visitors can explore the development of the Finnish game industry from small hobbyist projects to international top productions. The museum features themed rooms decorated in the style of different eras, allowing guests to experience the atmosphere of gaming across the decades. You can play classic arcade games, visit a Commodore 64 enthusiast's room, and play NES games from the early 1990s in a home setting. While focusing on digital games, the museum also highlights traditional games, popular board games and role-playing games.

name: Suomen tietokonemuseo
description:
The Finnish Computer Museum, Suomen tietokonemuseo, is located in Jyväskylä. It is dedicated to preserving the history of computers and computing technology in Finland. The museum features a collection of computing devices used in Finland from the early 20th century to the present day. It was formerly known as the Finnish Data Processing Museum.

The museum has several unique computers, including five that were among the first computer models in Finland. The Ukrainian MIR-2 computer is reportedly the only one of its kind outside the former Eastern Bloc. The museum also has a wide selection of IBM punch card machines. It is managed by the Finnish Data Processing Museum Association. The museum is open on Thursdays from 10:00 to 12:00 and also arranges guided tours by appointment.

name: Suomen valokuvataiteen museo
description: The Finnish Museum of Photography is a national specialized museum dedicated not only to photographic art but also to other areas of photography. It is located in Helsinki's Cable Factory (Kaapelitehdas). The museum's mission is to promote and cherish Finnish photographic art and culture. The museum has a collection of about 3.7 million photographs, encompassing various uses of photography. The collection includes both Finnish and foreign material but focuses on 20th-century Finnish photography and also has an exhibition space K1 in Kämp Galleria, right in the heart of Helsinki. The exhibitions showcase both the history and the present day of Finnish photography, as well as featuring changing domestic and foreign exhibitions.

name: Suomenlinnan lelumuseo
description:
The Suomenlinna Toy Museum was a private collection showcasing antique toys from the early 1800s to the collapse of the Soviet Union. The museum displayed a variety of vintage toys, including dolls, tin toys, teddy bears, and dollhouses, all collected from Finland, reflecting Finnish play and culture.

Located in Suomenlinna, the museum aimed to evoke nostalgia and allow visitors to admire beautiful artifacts and reflect on the past. A charming tea room, Café Samovarbar, and a specialized museum shop were connected to the museum. However, the museum is now closed and looking for a new home for its collection.

name: Suomussalmen kotiseutumuseo
description:
The Suomussalmi Local Heritage Museum is located on the shore of Lake Kiantajärvi in Kirkkoniemi. Established in 1967, the museum preserves local heritage and passes on traditional knowledge.

Its extensive collection of artifacts and large yard reflect life in the Kainuu region during the 19th and 20th centuries. The main building, Alanteen pirtti, was transported from the shore of Lake Alanteenjärvi. The oldest part of the house is a smokehouse built in the late 18th century. The museum is open during the summer, and there is an entrance fee.

name: Suur-Savon museo
description:
The Suur-Savo Museum is a cultural history museum located in Mikkeli. It's situated in a grey stone storehouse built in 1848 as a granary for the Mikkeli parish. The building has been used as a museum since 1960.

The museum showcases the history of Mikkeli and the surrounding region. Its collections include South Savo peasant artifacts and items related to the history of the city. The museum also features temporary exhibitions, often held in its own spaces. Besides exhibiting, the Suur-Savo Museum is dedicated to preserving and researching the history of Mikkeli and its region.

name: Säräisniemen kotiseutumuseo
description:
The Säräisniemi Local History Museum is the only museum showcasing the local heritage of the entire Vaala municipality. It operates in the oldest school building in the Säräisniemi village, dating back to the turn of the 18th and 19th centuries, which was converted into a school in 1884. The museum is maintained by the Säräisniemi Museum and Local Heritage Association, founded in 1957.

In the museum grounds, you can also find Juusola's windmill from the 1830s, Säräisniemi's granary from the 1860s, and Alila's storehouse from the 1880s. The museum's basic collection was gathered from different villages in Vaala in the late 1950s and has been supplemented several times since then, now holding over 3,500 items. The collections are displayed in both permanent and rotating exhibitions.

name: Söderlångvikin kartano
description:
Söderlångvik Manor, located in Kemiönsaari, is about 170 km from Turku and was once the summer residence of Amos Anderson, a famous businessman and patron of the arts. The manor has been restored to its former glory and is now open as a museum.

The Söderlångvik Manor museum showcases Amos Anderson's personal history and art collections. The main building was renovated in the 1930s, transforming it into an Italian-style villa. The interior has a classic style, featuring antique furniture and stylish furniture made later.

The estate is also known for its beautiful cultural landscape, including one of Finland's largest apple orchards and the protected Purunpää forest areas. Visitors can explore three marked nature trails that start from the manor. The café in the former cowshed offers a wide variety of treats, including local products.

name: Taidekeskus Kasarmi
description:
Taidekeskus Kasarmi is an art and culture center located in Hyrylä, in the municipality of Tuusula. It is primarily home to the Tuusula Art Museum. The building itself is a former Russian barracks completed in 1915, initially intended for use as a hospital.

The art center offers modern art exhibitions within the rugged framework of the Russian barracks in the center of Hyrylä. In both the main building and the AuneLa side building, contemporary art is presented, often playfully and boldly. In addition to paintings and graphic art, the art museum focuses on contemporary Finnish sculptures. Taidekeskus Kasarmi also hosts workshops, performances, and concerts.

name: Taidemuseo Eemil
description:
Taidemuseo Eemil is an art museum located in Lapinlahti, North Savo. It showcases the art of the Halonen artist family, particularly the works of sculptor Eemil Halonen (1875–1950). The museum is managed by the Halonen Museum Foundation.

In addition to the permanent collection, Taidemuseo Eemil features changing exhibitions of Finnish contemporary art, with an emphasis on sculpture, regional art, and art education for children and young people. The museum's address is Suistamontie 3, 73100 Lapinlahti. It is easily accessible by public transport, with a walking distance of about 15 minutes from the Lapinlahti train and bus stations.

name: Taipaleen kanavamuseo
description:
The Taipale Canal Museum is located in Varkaus, in the Taipale Canal area. Situated in the Northern Savonia route of the Vuoksi waterway, the Taipale Canal is a functioning deep-water canal, and the area also features a museum canal completed in 1840.

The museum's main exhibition, "Via Canalia," showcases the history of canal construction and water traffic in Northern Savonia. Visitors can explore the Taipale Canal area, including the museum canal and the currently operational deep-water canal. The canal's history is presented both in the Canal Museum and on information boards along the Canal Path that circles the area. The Taipale guest harbor is located above the canal. It is open during the summer months and has free entry.

name: Talomuseo Glims
description:
Talomuseo Glims is an old farm located in Espoo, in the village of Karvasmäki. It offers a peaceful escape to the countryside. The farm has been active since the 1500s and also served as an inn. The museum area consists of 11 original buildings, the oldest of which date back to the 1700s. The area was converted into a museum in 1958 and is part of the Espoo City Museum.

Visitors can explore how people lived in the late 1800s. The museum has changing exhibitions and events, such as demonstrations and guided tours. There is also a museum shop and a café. Glims is located near Jorvi Hospital and the former Helsinki-Turku highway, close to the Glims River.

name: Talonpoikaismuseo Yli-Kirra
description:
Talonpoikaismuseo Yli-Kirra, also known as "Koiramäki House," is a local history museum in Punkalaidun. It represents a typical 19th-century Satakunta farmhouse built in a courtyard style. The buildings are situated around the main yard and the livestock yard.

The museum area also includes other 1800s farmhouse buildings, such as a barn, a smithy, and outbuildings. Opened in 1954, it's known as the model for Mauri Kunnas' "Doghill" children's books. A crofter's area shows the living conditions of the landless population of the 1800s, featuring a smoke sauna, cooking shed, and outdoor oven.

The museum also presents the mechanization of agriculture in the 1900s. The museum's machine department and exhibition hall display the development of grain harvesting from sickle to combine harvester. The exhibition hall also includes a school museum and handicraft items. The Yli-Kirra museum area covers several hectares and has around thirty buildings.

name: Tamminiemi
description:
Tamminiemi is a historic villa and museum located in Helsinki, Finland. It's situated on a beautiful seaside location and is best known as the former official residence of the President of Finland. Specifically, it was the home of President Urho Kekkonen for many years.

Today, Tamminiemi operates as a museum, offering visitors a glimpse into the life and times of President Kekkonen and Finnish history. The museum showcases the villa's original decor and furnishings, providing an authentic representation of the era. It is a popular destination for those interested in Finnish history and culture.

name: Tampereen kaupunginmuseo
description:
Tampereen kaupunginmuseo was a cultural history museum maintained by the city of Tampere. It was located in the Hatanpää area. The museum was founded on the initiative of the Häme Museum Society, at the same time as the municipal museum operations were created in Tampere in 1969.

The main building of Hatanpää Manor was renovated and transformed into the city museum. The museum was open to the public from 1970 to the 1990s. The museum's exhibition activities were largely based on the Häme Museum Society's urban historical collections.

In addition to the department on the history of the city of Tampere, the museum exhibited various period interiors from the late 18th century to the 1930s. The city museum focused on material related to the cultural history of Tampere and the life of the people of Tampere. The City Museum was closed, and its collection became part of the new museum center, Vapriikki, which opened in the autumn of 1996.

name: Tampereen kivimuseo
description:
The Tampere Mineral Museum is a natural history museum located in the Museokeskus Vapriikki in Tampere. The museum's collection includes over 8,000 items from more than 80 countries, with approximately 7,000 on display. You can find gemstones, ornamental stones, minerals, metals, meteorites, fossils, and synthetic stones.

Paavo Korhonen, an engineer and mineral enthusiast from Tampere, collected and donated the collection to the city. He hoped that the museum would inspire children and young people to study and collect stones. Currently, a special exhibit called "Kiven voima" (The Power of Stone) is open in Vapriikki, showcasing stones that have never been displayed before, and celebrating the museum's 10th anniversary in Vapriikki. The collection is considered Finland's largest and most diverse collection of stones and minerals collected by a single individual.

name: Tampereen luonnontieteellinen museo
description:
The Tampere Natural History Museum is a museum located in the Vapriikki Museum Centre in Tampere. It showcases the nature and animals of Pirkanmaa. The museum aims to bring nature and its biodiversity closer to people.

The museum's exhibitions introduce visitors to the stunning diversity of nature and highlight locally interesting natural phenomena, species and sites, focusing especially on Pirkanmaa's nature. Anyone can bring a biological sample or a question about nature to the museum's "nature doctor's reception" for identification. The museum also has targeted teaching packages for learners of different ages.

name: Tampereen palomuseo
description:
The Tampere Fire Museum is a specialized museum maintained by the Pirkanmaa Rescue Department. It is located in the basement of the Tampere Central Fire Station. The museum's exhibition extends from the founding of the Tampere Volunteer Fire Brigade in 1898 to the present day.

The museum showcases the work of the fire brigade and its evolution through interesting objects, photos, and videos. Visitors can explore life at the fire station, firefighter equipment, the history of first aid, changes in alarm systems, and inventions made by firefighters. The Central Fire Station, designed by Wivi Lönn and completed in 1908, is an architectural landmark in the Art Nouveau style.

name: Tampereen siirtolapuutarhamuseo
description:
The Tampereen Siirtolapuutarhamuseo (Tampere Allotment Garden Museum) is a cultural history museum located in the Niihama allotment garden in Tampere. It consists of three allotment cabins originating from the 1920s. These cabins were originally located in Hatanpää, Finland's first allotment garden area, which was established in 1916.

The museum showcases the interior design style of the cabins from their early days, as well as old tools. The museum is open to the public on summer Sundays. The Niihama Group Garden Association maintains the museum.

The museum reminds visitors of the first steps of allotment garden culture. One cabin presents the history of the association, another displays old tools and hobby equipment, and the third, Nordfors cabin, is in its original condition, illustrating life in the allotment gardens.

name: Tampereen taidemuseo
description:
Tampere Art Museum, located near Pyynikintori in the Amuri district, is the third oldest art museum in Finland. Housed in a former granary designed by C.L. Engel and built in 1838, it showcases diverse themes from art history, as well as contemporary art from Finland and abroad.

The museum is known for its "Young Artist of the Year" event and exhibition. The Tampere Art Museum regularly organizes art events and projects in the urban space. The museum only has changing exhibitions, which can be checked on the museum's website. It is open all year round, but closed during exhibition changes. The Moomin Museum, managed by the art museum, is also a notable part.

name: Tarvasjoen kotiseutumuseo
description:
The Tarvasjoki local history museum is located next to the church in Tarvasjoki. The museum is housed in an old granary.

The lower floor exhibition, "People's Tarvasjoki," showcases the history of life in Tarvasjoki, from prehistoric times to the present day. It highlights the diversity of rural settlements and the development of livelihoods. The lives and livelihoods of individual people are also presented. Upstairs, you can meet travelers of the Hämeen Härkätie, including Miina, who walked from Suurila to the Turku market to sell her butter. The museum also has a collection of local literature for sale. It is open during the summer months.

name: Teatterimuseo
description:
The Theatre Museum, located in Helsinki's Cable Factory, is Finland's only museum specializing in theatre and performing arts. It serves as the national museum responsible for preserving Finnish theatre, dance, opera, circus, and performance art heritage. The museum's collections include artifacts, documents, photographs, and audiovisual materials dating back to the 1830s.

The Theatre Museum's exhibitions, guided tours, and workshops offer visitors insights into the world of performing arts. The museum actively collects materials related to professional Finnish theatre and practitioners and its collections are used for research, media and to inform the general public.

name: Teiskon kotiseutumuseo
description:
Teisko Local Heritage Museum is located in the Terälahti district of Tampere. The museum showcases the rural life and traditions of the Häme region.

The museum's collections include over 2,000 items, and the area features several buildings, ranging from a smithy to a soldier's cottage. It provides a glimpse into the past with artifacts and photographs related to the area's history and culture, offering a unique opportunity to explore the heritage. The museum is open during the summer season.

name: Tekniikan museo
description: The Museum of Technology, founded in 1969, is located in the Old Town of Helsinki. It's the only general museum of technology in Finland. The museum tells the story of technology in Finland, from an agrarian society to a leading developer in the global high-tech market. Its main exhibitions, "TechLand" and "TeleDreams," explore this transformation. "The Ghost and the Invention Device" is an interactive exhibit for children. The museum is situated by the Vantaa River in buildings that once housed Helsinki's waterworks. The exhibitions are housed in the museum's round hall, which dates back to the 1870s.

name: Teresia ja Rafael Lönnströmin kotimuseo
description:
Teresia and Rafael Lönnström's Home Museum is the former residence of a Rauma-based industrialist couple, showcasing their art collection and elegant home. The house was completed in 1942 and opened as a museum in 1988, according to Teresia Lönnström's will.

The museum preserves the Lönnströms' home interior, including furniture, design objects, and art pieces. The art collection features Finnish and foreign art from the Golden Age to the present day. The lower floor includes a hall, coffee lounge, dining room, living room and Rafael Lönnström's study, while the upper floor features Teresia Lönnström's bedroom, guest room, hall and Else's room. Currently, the museum is closed due to renovation, with reopening planned for May 4, 2025.

name: Tervajärven talomuseo
description: Tervajärvi House Museum is a traditional Kainuu farmhouse in Sotkamo, located in the village of Sumsa. The museum includes the old main building from 1866, a storehouse, and two small storehouses. An exhibition building has been constructed along the road leading to the museum, displaying items related to peasant life. The museum is furnished to depict life in the house in the early 1950s. The farm has been owned by the Heikkinen family since the 17th century. In the 1940s and 1950s, life at Tervajärvi was peaceful, as a road to the house was not built until 1958, so many influences arrived slowly.

name: Tiedekeskus Tietomaa
description:
Tiedekeskus Tietomaa, Finland's first science center, opened its doors on June 29, 1988. It's located in the Myllytulli district of Oulu. The science center is housed in the former power station and water tower of the Veljekset Åström Oy leather factory.

Tietomaa aims to present achievements in science and technology in a fun and interesting way, making them accessible to the general public. It features theme exhibitions, a giant movie theater, a tower, a shop, and a café. Currently, Tietomaa is closed for renovations and is scheduled to reopen in the summer of 2026 as part of a new museum and science center complex in Oulu.

name: Tikanojan taidekoti
description:
Tikanojan taidekoti is an art museum located in the city center of Vaasa. It showcases both Finnish and international art, with a focus on French paintings from the 19th and early 20th centuries. The museum was established thanks to Frithjof Tikanoja, a local businessman, who donated his extensive private art collection to the city of Vaasa in 1951.

The collection features pieces from prominent artists and is displayed in Tikanoja's former home. In addition to exhibitions, the museum organizes concerts, matinees, and various art-related events throughout the year, such as art lectures. The museum actively collaborates with schools, emphasizing the importance of art and culture.

name: Tornionlaakson maakuntamuseo
description:
Tornionlaakson maakuntamuseo, also known as Tornedalens Museum, is a regional museum located in Tornio. Founded in 1914, it showcases the history and culture of the Tornio River Valley on both the Finnish and Swedish sides of the border. The museum's area of operation extends from Simo to Muonio.

The museum collects and preserves material culture and history of its operational area. It conducts research, teaching, and publishing activities. In 2014, the completely renovated museum was reopened to the public. On the museum grounds, visitors can see an old river boat and cannons found off the coast of Tornio.

name: Tornionlaakson museo
description:
The Tornionlaakso Museum, also known as Tornedalens Museum, is a regional museum that showcases the culture and history of the Tornio River Valley on both sides of the Finnish-Swedish border.
